UPDATE: The original policy restricted present-based teaching until April 10, I am updating it to May 11, when first and second graders were allowed to return to school.

description:
The authorities of the canton Schaffhausen announced on March 13th, 2020 that there will be no on-site teaching in the schools in the canton Schaffhausen, from March 16th onwards. There should be no on-site teaching until April 4th. The Schools should move to online teaching, the authorities said. 

Secondary schools and higher education institutions are allowed to go back to on-site teaching on June 8th, 2020. UPDATE: The original policy that all schools in the canton Schaffhausen have to end their on-site teaching has ended. Secondary schools and higher education instutitions are allowed to go back to on-site teaching on June 8th.

description: Following the federal decision from April 29, 2020, to allow presence-based teaching from May 11 onwards, the Swiss canton of Appenzell Innerrhoden has decided to allow presence-based teaching in full class size from May 11 onwards. While primary and compulsory schools (age 4-15) open from May 11, secondary and high schools (Sek II) open on June 8 in full class size. All schools need to follow federal regulations on social distancing and hygiene. If classrooms can not guarantee a distance of two meters between each participant, rooms need to be changed.

On March 23, in Switzerland the Canton Jura announced that
- all schools (compulsory and post-compulsory) will remain closed till April 30, 2020. 
- Admission to childcare facilities is limited to children who cannot benefit from a private daycare solution.

description: In Switzerland, the state council of the canton of Zurich decided at the 19th of march that the exams from the 25th of march will be moved to a later date because of the big numbers of candidates the health measures cant be met, thats why the oral exams and the creative aptitude tests will not take place.  This leads to adjustments of the admission procedure in middle schools and specialized middle school for the school year 2020/2021. For the admission, the result of the written examination will be decisive for pupils, according to the applicable admission regulations would have to take the oral exam. These pupils will be provisional accepted to the probationary period. The design aptitude tests for the K + S classes and the Liceo artisto will be exclusively based on the handed in documents of the candidates.
type: Closure and Regulation of Schools
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)

description:
On April 3, in Switzerland the Canton Jura announced an extended access to childcare facilities after April 6. 
In the absence of another private solution, parents working in the following areas can make requests: distribution of essential goods, bank, post office or even mobilization by civil protection or the army, provided that both spouses are active in these fields or that the request concerns a single-parent family .
 UPDATE: Originally all schools and childcare facilities were closed. Daycare was provided for children of medical and social staff. Now access to daycare is extended to children of parents working in essential business.
type: Closure and Regulation of Schools
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
On March 20 the Government Thurgau has announced, that Thurgau are following the decision of federal government and introduced the implementation phase with the duration from April 20 until Juli 3. 
It can be assumed that the COVID-19 regulation from 17.03.2020 will be extended and from April 20, 2020 regular lessons cannot be started. It is possible to define the framework conditions for the schools from this point on. UPDATE: The original implementation phase was set until July 3, it has been shortened until May 11 (the day in which school should be reopened for presence classes)
type: Closure and Regulation of Schools
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau published that the written part of the Matura and final exams at secondary schools and at the Aargau Maturity School for adults will take place as planned as well as oral exams in some subjects at the technical secondary school.
On the other hand, the oral exams at the high school and at the Aargau maturity school for adults will not take place. At the technical middle school, oral exams are to be carried out in those subjects in which these are intended as the only examination form.

description:
On April 23, 2020 Swiss Canton Geneva has extended the closure of all private and public schools and children day care facilities ( age 4 to 14) till May 11. Minimum daycare is provided for children (age 4-10) of families without any other option.
Childcare facilities for small children ( age 0-4) will start to gradually reopen after April 27. A new directive for these institutions is launched.

 UPDATE: The original school closure was first set to last until April 9, then it has been extended till April 26, now it is extended till May 11, 2020.

description:
On April 30 Ticino announced the reopening of compulsory schools as of May 11. However non-compulsory schools, i.e. high schools for children from 15-18 and higher education institutes, remain closed. 
Elementary school (age 6-12) reopen part-time (minimum of 4 half days or 2 full days) and reduced in number of students (maximum half of a section of 25 students). This also applies to kindergarten ( age 4-6), but attendance will be voluntary. As before emergency childcare is provided, but not extended.
For secondary schools, the return to class occurs fractionally. Each institution taking into account the number of its students and its particularities (transport, canteen etc.), will organize one partial presence of the classes in place for at least one day (or two half-days per week). Distance learning will be extended.
type: Closure and Regulation of Schools
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)

description:
On April 30, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Valais announced that compulsory schools resume step by step after May 11. A national protection concept for the safety of pupils and teachers is implemented.
The pupils of cycle 3 (orientation school,age 12-15 ), in which the schools are more centralized and there are specific transport problems, are taught in divided classes over a period of at least four weeks.

description:
On April 30, 2020 the Department of Education in Swiss canton of Basel - City the announced that as of May 11, 2020, lessons for children will begin in kindergarten ( age 4-5), primary school (age 6-12) and lower secondary level ( age 12-15) according to the usual lesson times and the regular timetable in their classes.
According to the requirements of the Federal Office of Health (BAG), the distance rules between teachers  and students must be observed as far as possible.This is not necessary between the students themselves. Children day care facilities ( age 0 to 12) will open as well, but group size remains limited to 10 children. Remote learning will go on for post-obligatory education.
type: Closure and Regulation of Schools
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
school_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions

description:
On May 1, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Fribourg announced that the pupils of the 1st and 2nd cycle ( age 4 to 12) will return to the compulsory schools on May 11th in half-classes, two days per weeks. Group A on Mondays and Thursdays,  group B on Tuesdays and Fridays. till May 25th.
For students of secondary I schools distance learning will continue. Private secondary schools may open according to their own order. Emergency childcare for school children will continue. Secondary II schools ( age 16 - 18 ) may resume in groups of 5 students.

description:
On April 30, the Swiss canton of Obwalden announced that in accordance with federal guidelines, compulsory in-person education would resume with a hygiene concept on May 11. Restrictions include: Staff members must maintain social distancing (2m) from each other and students. Students from 5th grade and older are encouraged to practice social distancing outside the classroom, this does not apply to younger students. Hands must be washed upon entering school premises. Classrooms must be aired after every class, surfaces must be cleaned regularly. All school members are discouraged from sharing food, beverages, and dishes. All school members must be actively trained on these rules.

Written final exams take place normally, but without oral exams.

More tight restrictions apply to non-compulsory education, especially vocational training.
type: Closure and Regulation of Schools
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
school_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

The use of separating plexiglass barriers is recommended.

description:
On May 1, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Fribourg announced that the pupils of the 1st and 2nd cycle ( age 4 to 12) will return to the compulsory schools on May 11th in half-classes, two days per weeks. Group A on Mondays and Thursdays,  group B on Tuesdays and Fridays. till May 25th.
For students of secondary I schools distance learning will continue. Private secondary schools may open according to their own order. Emergency childcare for school children will continue. Secondary II schools ( age 16 - 18 ) may resume in groups of 5 students. The policy was announced to last until the summer holidays, starting on July 6. 

 UPDATE: The policy was announced to last until the beginning of the holidays in the Fribourg province, starting on July 6.

description: On 13th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel ordered the closure of all schools, professional training centers, high schools, universities, "hautes coles" (specialized higher education institutions) and extra-familial care centers (eg: day-care centers), from 16th March 2020 to 4th April 2020. A minimum extra-familial care service will be however provided on certain conditions to families who can't keep their children at home (conditions: parents work in healthcare or security and have no other child care option). On 16th March 2020, this policy was extended to 19th April 2020 by the federal Ordinance 2 of 16th March 2020, which took over all cantonal measures. On 30th April 2020, the canton of Neuchtel announced that in-person classes would resume in half-classes ("demi-classe") on 11th May 2020 for cycles 1 and 2 of compulsory schooling (1st to 8th year of education), thus ending the original policy. UPDATE: The original closure of schools was set to end on 19th April 2020, but on 30th April 2020, the canton of Neuchtel announced that in-person classes would resume in half-classes ("demi-classe") on 11th May 2020 for cycles 1 and 2 of compulsory schooling (1st to 8th year of education), thus ending the original policy.
type: Closure and Regulation of Schools
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)

description:
On May 1, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Fribourg announced that
for students of secondary I schools (age 12 - 15) distance learning will continue till May 29. On May 28 and 29 ( Thursday and Friday) each school may decide to meet in reduced classes to prepare full school resumption after June 2.
Emergency childcare for school children will continue.
Private secondary schools may open according to their own guidelines. Secondary II schools ( age 16 - 18 ) may resume in groups of 5 students. The original measures announced were supposed to last until the holidays, starting on July 6. 

 UPDATE: The original measures announced were supposed to last until the holidays, whereas no clear end date is indicated for an end to hygiene measures etc.

description:
On April 30, 2020 the State Council of Swiss Canton Vaud presented the measure taken by the cantonal Department of Education to reopen obligatory schools safely according to the framework guidelines of the Federal Office of Health and after having coordinated a return to class with the other French-speaking cantons.
Level 1P to 8P ( age 4 to 12) is scheduled to resume in full classes as of May 25.
In canton Vaud summer break started July 6, 2020. UPDATE: The school policy was not changed till summer break, I end the policy with starting summer break.

description:
On May 26, 2020 the Departement of Education of the Swiss canton of Vaud presented its protection plan for the return of around 37,000 students and apprentices from Secondary II schools to class on June 8th ( age 16 and over) till summer break ( starting July 6th).
The spatial distance of 2 meters must be maintained between the students and between students and teachers.
The lessons take place in small groups, depending on the size of the rooms in square meters (1 person per 4 square meters).
Students will therefore come to school alternately every other day or every third day or respectively one week out of 2 or 3 for apprentices.
Homework is given for days without lessons. Only past year students who already received their title will not be required to return to class.
type: Closure and Regulation of Schools
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description:
On May 28, 2020 the Swiss Canton of Basel City announced that after the compulsory school (age 4-15) started classroom teaching on May 11, 2020, lessons will also start again at the vocational and upper secondary schools (age 15-18) from June 8, 2020. Social distancing (2m) must be maintained in the classroom. Depending on the spatial situation - there are different teaching models until summer break (June 26). At certain schools practically all students can attend face-to-face lessons, at others there is a mixture of face-to-face and distance learning.
Group size in childcare facilities is no longer restricted due to corona and school trips can resume as well.

description: On 28th May 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel announced that all post-compulsory schools (equivalent of high school) would resume in-person classes under conditions from 8th June 2020 on. Conditions are the following: people within schools have to keep a distance of 2 meters at least apart from one another; classes can be separated into different groups depending on the number of students per classes and the number of square meters in each classroom. Exceptions can be made for vulnerable students and teachers, who will have the possibility to continue online classes.

description: On May 28th, the the government of the Swiss Canton Solothurn announced that higher educational facilities (secondary level II), including vocational schools, would reopen on June 8th while adhering hygiene concepts. This includes permanent social distancing of 2m and the general calculation of 4 square metres per student in the classroms. Tele-teaching would still be offered, if needed. description:
On 30th April 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel announced its plan for the reopening of classes (for compulsory school, see records 8429061 and 1859975) but all post-compulsory schools (equivalent of high school) remain closed until further notice. Universities are to remain closed as well due to the absence of announcements regarding the resumption of classes. On 28th May 2020, the canton announced that in-person classes would resume under conditions in post-compulsory schools on 8th June 2020, thus ending this policy.

NB: there was no information on resumption of classes for universities, but one can consider the closure of universities ended as well because most (if not all) university calendars end in late May. UPDATE: The original closure of post-compulsory schools and universities didn't have an end date, but on 28th May 2020, the canton of Neuchtel announced that in-person classes would resume under conditions in post-compulsory schools on 8th June 2020, thus ending this policy.
type: Closure and Regulation of Schools
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On 30 April, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, announces the reopening of classrooms for middle and highschool students as well as vocational schools beginning on 8 June. Schools will reopen for half-time for two days, to begin. Students and faculty are set to follow hygiene precautions, social distancing measures. description: On August 10, the Swiss Canton Ticino, announces the new measures for the re-opening of schools on August 31. In general, schools are foreseen to reopen with face to face classes. Masks will be optional for middle and post-compulsory students, for teachers, it will be optional during lessons and mandatory in the common areas. The common measures of hygiene and social distancing apply. In compulsory school, the distance of 1.5 meters between students is not indicated as necessary. The distance between the teacher and the students and between the adults present is important. In the post-compulsory school, where children are considered as adults, the distance must also be maintained between students. As for some disciplines such as physical education, there will be specific indications to avoid sports that involve frequent direct physical contact between students.
type: Closure and Regulation of Schools
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)

description: In Switzerland, the canton Aargau declares at the 16th or March the state of emergency. This includes the ban of public and private events, closed shops, markets, restaurants, bars, museums, leisure facilities, libraries, cinemas, theatres, concert halls, gyms and swimming halls as well as shops where people cant keep enough distance like hairdressers and make up studios. Supermarkets, take-aways, company canteens, delivery services for food, pharmacies, gas stations, train stations, banks, post offices, hotels, car repair shops, public administration and social facilities will stay open will stay open as long as they fulfil the distance and hygiene regulations. Hospitals, clinics and doctors surgeries will stay open but not preform not urgent treatment. People with high risk of getting infected will be on payed leave. Day cares will only be closed if other appropriate care exists.
type: Declaration of Emergency
type_sub_cat: NA

description:
The swiss federal council decided that from the 11th of March 2020 on Switzerland cross-border travelling from Italy to Switzerland will be limited to only a few borders crossings. The small border crossings will be closed and the border traffic will be channeled to the big border crossings. 

Following the closed border crossings -> alternative open border crossings

Pedrinate -> Chiasso strada (Ponte Chiasso)
Ponte Faloppia -> Novazzano Brusata (Bizzarone) or Chiasso strada
Novazzano Marcetto -> Novazzano Brusata (Bizzarone) or Chiasso strada
San Pietro di Stabio -> Stabio Gaggiolo
Ligornetto Cantinetta -> Stabio Gaggiolo
Arzo -> Stabio Gaggiolo or Brusino Arsizio
Ponte Cremenaga -> Fornasette or Ponte Tresa
Cassinone -> Fornasette
Indemini -> Dirinella (Zenna)

Since the 9th of March 2020 the swiss border controls setup a monitoring system to monitor the effectiveness of the Italian measures. The border control (EZV) uses intensified sampling and checks that are carried out on a risk basis. An example of such measures would be the checking of passports.
type: External Border Restrictions
type_sub_cat: Visa extensions (e.g. visa validity extended)
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On March 13th 2020, the Swiss Federal Council re-opens federal border checks including Schengen checks, designed to limit incoming and outgoing traffic to Italy. Only Swiss citizens, people with a residence permit in Switzerland and people who have to travel to Switzerland for professional reasons are allowed to enter Italy. Transit and goods traffic are also allowed. Finally, people in a situation of absolute necessity may also enter from Italy.
type: External Border Restrictions
type_sub_cat: Visa extensions (e.g. visa validity extended)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Switzerland the swiss federal council decided that from the 25st of March on the frontier crossing ban would be changed. Instead of forbidding people from Spain, Germany, Austria and Italy and countries that are not part of the Schengen agreement it changed so nobody is allowed to enter Switzerland from countries in the Schengen agreement and all other countries. Only people from Liechtenstein were allowed to enter. Every person that wants to enter Switzerland from any country besides Liechtenstein will not be permitted to enter. This includes all possible ways of entering Switzerland like e.g. by foot, railway or airplane.
type: External Border Restrictions
type_sub_cat: Visa extensions (e.g. visa validity extended)
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On March 13th 2020, the Swiss Federal Council re-opens federal border checks including Schengen checks, designed to limit incoming and outgoing traffic to Italy. Every person that wants to enter Switzerland from Italy will not be permitted to enter. This includes all possible ways of entering Switzerland like e.g. by foot, railway or airplane. Only Swiss citizens, people with a residence permit in Switzerland and people who have to travel to Switzerland for professional reasons are allowed to enter Italy. Transit and goods traffic are also allowed. Finally, people in a situation of absolute necessity may also enter from Italy.

On March 16 5 other minor mountain passes were added to the temporary closure, namely Arogno, Brusino, Pizzamiglio, Camedo e Fornasette. UPDATE: Additional to the already closed 9 mountain passes on March 11, as of March 16 five other minor mountain passes are closed, i.e. Arogno, Brusino, Pizzamiglio, Camedo e Fornasette.

description: On March 17th 2020 the Swiss Federal Council (Schweizer Bundesrat) Closed additional to the already closed Italian border also the borders to Germany, France and Austria. Only Swiss citizens, people with a residence permit in Switzerland and people who have to travel to Switzerland for professional reasons are allowed to enter Italy. Transit and goods traffic are also allowed. Finally, people in a situation of absolute necessity may also enter. UPDATE: Originally the swiss border that was closed was only the border to Italy but now it is also the the borders to Germany, France and Austria

description:
In Switzerland the swiss federal council decided that from the 2nd of April 2020 on customs (Die Eidgenssische Zollverwaltung (EZV)) is allowed to close small border crossings independently if needed. The closure will be immediately reported to the EJPD, UVEK and the EDA. Costumes will mark closed borders and publishes based in this data a list of open borders in their website.

Also from the 2nd of April 2020 on customs will decide which streets for prior traffic (green lanes) will be kept to keep the flow of essential goods up that the state supply can be maintained. The same applies to essential workers, especially people working in health care. Customs will publish the list of the green lanes and which conditions are necessary to use them on their website

The same applies to essential workers, especially people working in health care. Customs will publish the list of the green lanes and which conditions are necessary to use them on their website

description:
In Switzerland the swiss federal council decided that from the 11th of march on that:
Immigrants that are not covered by the FZA or the agreement from the 4th of January 1960 about the formation of the EFTA-agreement do have to fulfil the additional entry fulfilments.
The responsible authorities are allowed to do risk-based controls 
Permission for immigrants that are entitled to free movement. Immigrants that are covered by the FZA or the EFTA, want to work in Switzerland for a short time are allowed to enter if:
-If the permit is in the interest of the public, especially in economic state supply 
-For family reunification 
-If the request for employment got handed in at the correct cantonal office before the 25th of march 2020 or if there was already a contract of employment with a swiss company 
-If the request for short term cross-border service is in line with the notification procedure and the service agreement was signed before the 25th of march 2020 
Immigrants that are not covered by the FZA and EFTA agreement are allowed to enter Switzerland if:
-They are in a situation of necessity or if they are health workers
-they got an entry permit before the 19th or march 2020 but the entry permit, visa, or a  residence permit that couldnt get certificated because of the current COVID-19 measures
-if the request of the employer got handed in before the 19th of march 2020. 
the migration of family members of swiss citizens based on article 42 AIG3 UPDATE: The swiss federal council published new laws for the entry permission
type: External Border Restrictions
type_sub_cat: Visa extensions (e.g. visa validity extended)
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description:
On July 1st, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council decided that from July 6th on all persons who enter Switzerland and who have been in a high risk Sars-CoV-2 country/ area within the last 14 days have to quarantine for 10 days (at home or in another appropiate accommodation). They have to report themselves within 2 days to the responsible cantonal authorities.Persons who have to go into quarantine are not entitled to loss of earnings compensation. Non - compliance can be fined.
Excepted are persons 
a. who professionally transport people or goods across borders
b. whose activity is absolutely necessary for maintaining the functionality of the health system or public security or international institutions
c. who have stayed in a risk country in the course of their professional activity in companies involved in rail, bus, ship or air transport 
d. who have to travel to Switzerland daily or up to 5 days for occupational or medical necessities
e. who have been less than 24h in a risk country (transit passengers)
f. who just pass through Switzerland.
The FOPH has a list of the countries concerned, which it updates regularly: Argentina, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Bahrain, Belarus, Bolivia, Brazil, Chile, Dominican republic, Honduras, Iraq, Israel, Cabo Verde, Qatar, Colombia, Kosovo, Kuwait, Moldova, North Macedonia, Oman, Panama, Peru, Russia, Saudi Arabia, Sweden, Serbia, South Africa, Turks- and Caicos islands (UK), USA
type: External Border Restrictions
type_sub_cat: Visa extensions (e.g. visa validity extended)
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs,Ministry/Department of Justice,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description:
On the 2nd of July 2020, the Swiss Federal Council decided that from the 6th of July on that people that enter Switzerland from a high risk Sars-CoV-2 country/ region have to go directly to their flat or another appropriate accommodation and self-isolate themselves there for 10 day and have to report themselves within 2 days to the responsible cantonal authorities.

People that enter Switzerland from a high risk country that do not have to quarantine themselves are people that work in this country, or people that transport goods per airplane, railway, streets and ships, whose occupation is necessary for the operativeness of the health system, safety and order, institutional beneficiaries, people that work in passenger traffic and transport passengers to high risk countries per railway, bus, ship and airplane, people that have to travel to Switzerland daily or up to 5 days for occupational or medical necessities, transit passengers that are less than 24h in a high risk country/ region, if they just pass through Switzerland.

High risk countries: Argentina, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Bahrain, Belarus, Bolivia, Brazil, Chile, Dominican republic, Honduras, Iraq, Israel, Cape Verde, Qatar, Colombia, Kosovo, Kuwait, Moldova, North Macedonia, Oman, Panama, Peru, Russia, Saudi Arabia, Sweden, Serbia, South Africa, Turks- and Caicos islands, USA

 UPDATE: High risk countries changed. Additional self quarantine and exceptions about who is allowed to enter from high risk countries
type: External Border Restrictions
type_sub_cat: Visa extensions (e.g. visa validity extended)
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description:
The list of countries considered as risk countries was updated on 23 July 2020 by the Swiss Government. From July 6th on all persons who enter Switzerland and who have been in a high risk country within the last 14 days have to quarantine for 10 days. They have to report to the cantonal authorities that carry out spot checks. Contact details are provided by flights or bus services selected at random. Quarantined persons do not get loss of earnings compensation. Non - compliance can be fined.
Excepted are persons who
professionally transport people or goods across borders
whose activity is necessary the functionality of the health system, public security or some international institutions
have stayed in a risk country in the course of their professional activity in companies involved in rail, bus, ship or air transport 
have to travel to Switzerland daily or up to 5 days for occupational or medical necessities
transit passengers
just pass through Switzerland

The list of considered risk countries was updated on August 8, 2020 by the Swiss FOPH. As before all persons entering Switzerland coming from a risk country have to quarantine for 10 days, a negative test result does not exempt from the mandatory quarantine requirement. description: Switzerland January 27, Ticino invites citizens who travelled to China in the last 14 days and who demonstrate respiratory problems and/or fever to avoid presenting themselves in health facilities but to contact their family doctor only by telephone, or the Rescue Center 144 or the emergency medical service.

description: The Swiss Canton Grisons implements contact tracing with the first confirmed cases on February 27. It is not announced as official policy but since that moment systematically used and implemented.
type: Health Monitoring
type_sub_cat: NA

description: Since the first case was confirmed in Canton Zug on 3 March, contact tracing has been a fundamental part of the control measures. This will be a key strategy for the future, too.
type: Health Monitoring
type_sub_cat: NA

description: Since the first case was confirmed in Canton Zug on 3 March, contact tracing has been a fundamental part of the control measures. This will be a key strategy for the future, too. UPDATE: Due to the decrease in new infections with the coronavirus, contact tracing is to be carried out again consistently throughout Switzerland. The Canton of Zug, in cooperation with the Lung League of Central Switzerland, has already established daily contact with all infected persons and the close contact persons and will intensify these efforts. Comprehensive contact tracing is a recognised means of identifying and interrupting chains of infection.
type: Health Monitoring
type_sub_cat: NA

description:
From 13th March 2020 on, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel has been monitoring the health of patients suspected of Covid-19 if they were sent back home by the coronavirus triage centers. The centers' personnel regularly monitors the evolution of the symptoms of each individual through phone calls.

NB: as a reminder, the triage centers decide whether suspect patients should be sent to the hospital or back home, and if they should get tested or not.
type: Health Monitoring
type_sub_cat: NA

description: On March 27th, 2020, it was announced that the cantons of Appenzell Innerrhoden and Appenzell Ausserrhoden, Switzerland, have established a new medical hotline to use by people who show symptoms of Covid-19 and who wish to be tested in testing facilities in the two cantons.
type: Health Monitoring
type_sub_cat: NA

description: The canton of Appenzell Innerrhoden, Switzerland, has announced that starting from March 28th, 2020, there will be a new test facility for suspected Covid-19 cases placed in front of the Hospital Appenzell which will determine whether patients are to be hospitalized or not.
type: Health Monitoring
type_sub_cat: NA

description: The Canton of Zug is using contact tracing of COVID-19 positive patients and regular checkups with individuals self-isolating with symptoms on March 31st 2020 to map the spread of the virus.

description: The canton Zurich (Switzerland) starts a "society monitoring Covid-19" process on March 31.

description:
Switzerland, Geneva--The canton of Geneva, in relationship with the Directorate of General Health, announced April 1 that they have developed at 3 tier patient contact and monitoring system. The three-part system is comprised of CoviCall, CoviCheck, and CoviCare. 

CoviCall is for symptomatic individuals to get direction on whether to stay home, go see a doctor, go to a sampling/monitoring site, or go to the hospital.
CoviCheck centralizes all the positive results transmitted by the laboratories.
CoviCare is an outpatient monitoring network for suspected and confirmed cases.
type: Health Monitoring
type_sub_cat: NA

Cantonal authorities will contact people who tested positive and identify potential contacts who could be at risk. This policy is supervised by the cantonal doctor and it will be implemented from 29th April 2020 on. The police will participate in this contact tracing scheme.

description: On May 7, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg started using a tracking system by the WHO in order to trace and monitor the contacts of persons with a positive COVID-19 test result. These persons will then be notified and be checked upon after 5-10 days. The estimate expects approximately 8 contact persons per tested individual and has a capacity of 10 persons to be tracked per day.

description: In Switzerland, the canton Aargau will launch a contact tracing centre on May 11 for the accompaniment and care of people in self-isolation and self-quarantine. The infected people and their closest contest have to stay home and will be briefed, taken care of and supervised by the contact tracing centre.

description: The Swiss canton Zurich expands contact tracing: From May 11, a new Contact,tracing team with 25 people starts work.

description:
The Cantonal Medical Service of the Canton of Aargau offers a comprehensive service package to people who have recently become infected with COVID-19. These people will be contacted, advised and instructed individually. This service is provided by a new competence and coordination center of the cantonal medical service, the CONTI.

The exchange of information and data takes place primarily by telephone. Patients and healthcare institutions such as doctors or test laboratories can also enter their data electronically using an appropriate secure web form
type: Health Monitoring

description: Switzerland, the canton Glarus uses contact tracing again from May 11, 2020 onwards. With the contact tracing it will be possible to track persons who were in contact with a infectious person, the cantonal authorities.

description:
In Switzerland, in the canton Aargau the Cantonal Medical Service of Aargau offers from the 11th of May on a comprehensive service package to people who have recently become infected with COVID-19. These people will be contacted, advised and instructed individually. This service is provided by a new competence and coordination center of the cantonal medical service, the CONTI.

The exchange of information and data takes place primarily by telephone. Patients and healthcare institutions such as doctors or test laboratories can also enter their data electronically using an appropriate secure web form

description:
On May 11, the Swiss Canton Grisons announces that a team from the Health Department, supported by medical professionals and members of civil protection, resumed work on contact tracing. The aim is to interrupt the chain of infection by recording the sick and their contact persons and putting them in isolation (sick) or quarantine (contact). The COVID Care Team of the Graubnden Health Department accompanies the affected people during this time. 

The Swiss Canton Grisons never officially announced contact tracing as policy. However, since the first confirmed cases, it was systematically implemented and used. After around two weeks this was not possible anymore and the "extraordinary" situation and respective measures were implemented on March 13. UPDATE: The Swiss Canton Grisons never officially announced contact tracing as policy. However, since the first confirmed cases, it was systematically implemented and used. Since the beginning of March (roughly March 8) this was not possible anymore and the "extraordinary" situation and respective measures were implemented on March 13. On May 11, contact tracing and the piloting of an app was officially announced in line with federal requirements regarding the re-opening.
type: Health Monitoring
type_sub_cat: NA

description: Valais (Switzerland) announces on May 14, that 4 people are conducting 7 to 10 contact tracing investigations a day. If necessary, the personal capacity can be increased to 20 people.
type: Health Monitoring
type_sub_cat: NA

description:
In Switzerland the state of emergency ended at the 19th of June, since then the the crisis management is carried out by the the cantonal medical service responsible in accordance with the Epidemics Act or the Department of Health and Social Affairs. They will adopt and implement the cantonal instructions and measures necessary to prevent further virus spread. As a first step, the canton of Aargau will introduce an ID for bar and club visits from Friday, July 3, 2020, 6 p.m.
For this purpose, the canton of Aargau is introducing an ID requirement for visits to bars and clubs. The general decree will come into effect on Friday, July 3, 2020, at 6 p.m.
The identification requirement applies to bar and club businesses. Restoration companies with a bar area and few standing places are excluded. The identification requirement ensures that identity is verified by obliging bar and club operators to compare the entries with a reliable official ID (passport, identity card or driver's license) when maintaining the presence list.
type: Health Monitoring
type_sub_cat: NA
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Switzerland, Geneva--The Department of Security, Employment and Health (DSES), the Grand Conseil de la nuit and the company 2GIK Srl have announced the deployment of an app that "allows the cantonal doctor's service to obtain, in the event of a proven COVID-19 case, the list of people in contact with the patient, to warn them of possible contamination and to inform them of the measures to be taken." The app has been active since June 20 with certain venues, but following July 23 the app will be extended to all members of the Grand conseil de la nuit.
type: Health Monitoring

description: On 13th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel created 7 triage centers to sort suspect patients depending on the seriousness of their symptoms, and decide whether or not they should get tested. Based on several health checks conducted at the centers (fever checks, blood pressure, oxygen saturation tests...), patients are either sent to the hospital or back home. An 8th center managed by Mdecins du Monde has also been created to welcome undocumented immigrants and asylum seekers. A telephone line has been opened to book appointments at the centers. This policy overall aims at relieving the congestion in hospitals.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure

description:
In Switzerland, the state council of the canton Zurich decided that from the 1st of April on additional health workers have to be hired because the outbreak of COVID-19 shows that the cantonal medical service is only able to handle smaller, local exposures but it is not set up for large, nationwide events.
The detailed list is:

-	1.0 positions senior physician, (wage class 22) 
-	1.8 positions Research Associate, (wage class 20) 
-	0.5 positions as an assistant doctor, (wage class 19) 
-	1.0 position administrative secretary, (wage class 12) 

This is a total job increase of 4.3
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure

description: As of Thursday, March 19, 2020, in Switzerland the Health Department of Canton Basel-Stadt has drawn up a graded care concept in the sense of an integrated solution, including the following public and private hospitals: Basel University Hospital, Claraspital, Felix Platter University Medical Center, Adullam Hospital, Bethesda Hospital and Merian Iselin Clinic.The hospitals have agreed on who provides which capacities, who takes over which activities and who can supplement in what form.

description: In Switzerland, the state council of the canton Zurich allowed that for the processing of protective material orders by the Zurich health care facilities the cantonal pharmacy sets up a separate web shop and an order office. The occupation of the web shop and for additional staff in company pandemic management and to secure the supply contract the cantons pharmacy will reinforce itself with external temporal staff as a supply-related company this action will be for the time being be limited to six months. Of the required seven places, three places are in the order office and four in job pandemic management.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure

description: In Switzerland, the state council of the canton Zurich decided that the cantonal pharmacy of Zurich is authorized to perform the service contract with Post CH AG. This is based on the fact that the current measures are not suitable for the continuous operation with its expected handling volumes and frequencies of more than 100 orders per day. Therefore, to provide the needed supply to around 6000 health care institutions (hospitals, medical practices etc.) in the canton of Zurich with protective material it is necessary to find as fast as possible a new warehouse and delivery logistics with an external logistics service provider being constructed
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure

description: In Switzerland, in the canton Zurich the medical association organizes on behalf of the health department of the Canton of Zurich (AGZ) the medical emergency service. It operates to do so with its subsidiary AGZ Support AG through the canton and the municipalities financed triage centre, which can be reached 24/7 via the emergency number 0800 33 66 55 is. This triage centre comes to ensure orderly care and triage of patients in the event of a pandemic and plays an important role for the greatest possible relief of the emergency departments of hospitals because it is the first point of contact for the residents when symptoms of COVID-19 appear. The triage centre is located in Zurich Oerlikon. It is set up to deal with a high load of calls through 12 additional external employees that answer these calls in home office. To be prepared for the worst case scenario of a severely restricted accessibility of the triage centre for the employees or a larger amount of sick employees additional 25 home office jobs will be created.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 22, 2020 in Switzerland the three cantons of Basel-City, Basel-Landschaft and Jura announced that the French Departement Haut-Rhin sent an urgent request for support to the three cantons on March 20. In consultation with the federal authorities, the three governments have agreed that two ICU patients each from Alsace can be transferred to the University Hospital Basel, the Cantonal Hospital Baselland, and the Hpital du Jura.

description: On March 27th, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health announced that with the help of Swisscoms analyses and visualisations, it is assessing whether the ban on gathering of more than five people in public ( by the Federal Council as of March 21st) is being respected. At no point location data from Swisscom are provided, merely analyses and visualisations. The data on which the analyses are based are anonymised and aggregated. It is not possible to make inferences about specific individuals. As soon as COVID-19 Ordinance 2 is abrogated, the Federal Office will not be provided with any further analyses.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure

description: The Swiss canton of Lucerne, has on March 23rd, 2020, announced that a new "drive-in" testing facility is available for people who have been cleared to be tested by a doctor. The new facility, opened from Monday to Friday from 1 to 5 pm, guarantees for more efficient and fast testing of suspected cases of Covid-19.

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau decided at the 1st of April that from the 2nd of April on the hospitals are exempted from certain regulations within the scope of fulfilling the special regulation (SonderV 20-1).

To authorize the hospitals for treatment regardless of the hospital list  8 para. 3 of the ordinance on the hospital list about the barriers and the spectrum of the service orders placed on the hospital list is suspended
Irrespective of the performance mandate, hospitals are authorized to treat patients within their medical area of competence. 
Treatments that are performed outside an assigned performance mandate and within the medical competence area are to be billed based on the Aargau tariff specified by the Department of Health and Social Affairs (DGS) in a specific case. The approved Aargau tariff for early rehabilitation is to be applied for the convalescence departments to be created by rehabilitation clinics.
Based on Section 7 (4) of the hospital list, the Department of Health and Social Affairs can also issue hospitals that do not fulfill the requirements of Section 2 (2) of the hospital list as well as the procedure, the documents and the procedure in accordance with Section 35 hospital list. 

To authorize inpatient care facilities to create bed capacity  13 para. 1 letter b and para. 2 of the Nursing Ordinance (PflV) is suspended.
The  4 para. 2 letter b of the Care Act (PflG), the guideline value for the proof of need is suspended.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure

description:
On march 31,2020 in Switzerland the Government of Canton Jura announced that three consultation centers for patients contaminated with coronavirus or likely to be will be operational from Thursday, April 2, 2020.
These three centers will be opened in Saignelgier, in Delmont and in Alle, respectively one point of care per district.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure

description: In Switzerland, the canton Aargau the Department of health and social affairs decided that from the 6th of April on the empty asylum seekers home at the maintenance area Frick that got closed will be used as an isolation ward for maximum 50 people. The cantonal social service, the Securitas AG, medical staff and civil defence will be in action and offer support. People with light symptoms or suspected cases will be accommodated there. Security and meals will be warranted.

description: On April 7, in cooperation with other Swiss Cantons and hospitals, the Canton of Fribourg received purchased health resources from China to support its COVID-19 response for hospitals, care homes, care at home, ambulances, and other health institutions. The resources could supply the whole health system for Fribourg for 10 days and consist of 995400 surgical masks, 229680 FFP2 masks, 220000 goggles, and 1347000 gloves.

description: As of April 8, 2020, the cantonal government of Nidwalden (Switzerland) has approved a loan of 130.000 CHF to purchase medical supplies and protective equipment for the canton. The purchase primarily consists of face masks and gloves, but also includes protective suits, goggles, disposable pinafores, and disinfecting towels.

description:
On April 9 the Canton Thurgau announced, that Die Thurgauer Kantonalbank intrust  the property of the former Linde restaurant 
as a short-term emergency solution for free use until around mid-June 2020. The apartments are to be occupied by people in asylum

description: On 13th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel created 7 triage centers to sort suspect patients depending on the seriousness of their symptoms, and decide whether or not they should get tested. Based on several health checks conducted at the centers (fever checks, blood pressure, oxygen saturation tests...), patients are either sent to the hospital or back home. An 8th center managed by Mdecins du Monde has also been created to welcome undocumented immigrants and asylum seekers. A telephone line has been opened to book appointments at the centers. This policy overall aims at relieving the congestion in hospitals. On 15th April 2020, the canton of Neuchtel reduced the number of triage centers from 8 to 5 in order to match the demand and the resources. UPDATE: The original policy featured 7 triage centers to sort Covid-19 suspect patients, but on 15th April 2020, they were reduced to 5 centers.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure

description: On April 16, the Swiss Canton Grisons announces to coordinate the organization of low-cost accommodation for workers from Italy with the affected communities in the regions of Bernina, Maloja and Engiadina Bassa / Val Mstair and sets up a hotline for cross-border commuters.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau the Federal Department of Home Affairs decided that from the 16th of April on the daily flat rate in convalescence departments in the rehabilitation clinics for covid-19 is CHF 913.

The canton Aargau offers people with low income a premium reduction for their health insurance premiums
If their financial situation gets worse there will be the possibility for more than 6 months to get an extraordinary adjustment for their premium reduction. This would be the case if the income decreased by at least 20%. Also, the senior civil servant decided that the waiting period of 6 months for the premium reduction will be abrogated.

For all persons who are currently on the list of defaulting insured persons, the postponement of benefits will be suspended from now until the extraordinary situation has ended.

The use of the mobile PalliativeSidelx enables COVID-19 patients in retirement homes without specialization for extreme palliative situations to be accompanied, fearless and dignified in the familiar environment.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

After finishing the course there will be a practical use of minimum 8 weeks (320h) in a retirement home, home care or in an acute-care hospital.

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau gifted from the 24th to the 27th of April in total 280000 masks to around 19000 reopened businesses. Masks were handed out in the cities Baden, Frick, Klliken und Wohlen
The cantonal police of Aargau, the with the industrial and trade supervision of the office for economy and labor as well as the office for consumer protection started first checks of businesses. These checks showed that businesses own a safety concept and that they are ready to implement the guidelines by the federal office of public health.

If the controlling bodies find slight deficits they will take care of them on site. They inform and sensitize the employees and the business about the protective measures and guidelines.
type: Health Resources

description: On April 24, the Swiss Canton Grisons allows again non-essential surgical interventions under strict safety and protection measures. UPDATE: On April 24, the Swiss Canton Grisons announces that hospitals and clinics are allowed to carry out "usual interventions" under strict safety conditions.

description: On 22nd March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel announced that the military would provide assistance in the 2 Neuchtel hospitals from 23rd March on by making 90 soldiers and 4 ventilators available to the canton. The soldiers will take charge of basic care to allow civil medical professionals to focus on more important treatments and Covid-19 cases. On 24th April 2020, the canton announced that the military would withdraw in the evening from the cantonal hospitals, now that the peak period of the epidemic was over. The canton specified that the soldiers could be called back within 24 hours and deployed within 72 hours if the situation worsened again. UPDATE: The original mobilization of the military in the Neuchtel hospitals had no end date, but on 24th April 2020, the canton announced that the army would withdraw from the hospitals in the evening of the same day.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure

description: Switzerland, canton Glarus  Hospital Treatments are postponed, March 17 2020. All non urgent hospital treatments and outpatient appointments are postponed. From April 27, the hospital is allowed to conduct non-urgent treatments. UPDATE: From April 27, the hospital is allowed to conduct non-urgent treatments.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country

description: On 12th March 2020, the RHNe (hospital network) in the Swiss canton of Neuchtel decided to cancel all non-essential elective surgeries from 13th March 2020 on. The measure will be effective until further notice and during the whole peak period of the epidemic. The policy overall aims at making more resources available (hospital staff, hospital beds) to welcome Covid-19 patients. On 23rd April 2020, the RHNe announced that it would resume non-essential elective surgeries on 27th April 2020, thus ending the original policy. UPDATE: The original cancellation of non-essential elective surgeries didn't have an end date; but on 23rd April 2020, the RHNe (hospital network of Neuchtel) announced that it would resume elective surgeries on 27th April 2020.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On 3rd May 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel announced that the military would provide assistance in 7 cantonal EMS ("tablissements mdico-sociaux", nursing homes) from 4th May 2020 to 24th May 2020. 34 soldiers will be made available to the EMS as of now, but their number can be reassessed and the length of their mobilization can be extended if need be.
type: Health Resources

description: In Switzerland, the canton of Aargau let especially produce 69,000 protective coats and one million protective masks in China, for nursing homes and Spitex organizations. The protective material arrived in Aarau at the 4th of May. Allocation is based on the weekly cantonal data collection. The material can then be picked up at the Zeughaus Aarau.
type: Health Resources

description: On May 7, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg announced the opening of 4 new fast-testing centres in order to allow testing of persons experiencing mild symptoms that can then be isolated, and of whom the contacts can be traced.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure

description: From May 11, amid the easing of the national lockdown, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg decided to provide 100,000 masks to customers of public transport in order to ensure the maintenance of hygiene measures.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure

description: On 27th April 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel announced that health protection resources would be allocated to schools at their reopening on 11th May 2020, including liquid soap, disposable hand towels, hand sanitizer and disinfectant. Masks will also be provided in specific situations: use in case of symptoms, use for the way back home or use in case pupils have to wait together inside a building.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The canton Glarus requested the Swiss army to support the canton in it's fight against the corona pandemic. The soldiers support the hospital, the information hotline and conduct transportation of patients. This policy starts on April 1st, 2020. The policy ends on May 12. UPDATE: The policy ends on May 12.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure

description: On 17th March 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel sent 50 members of the civil protection to provide assistance in the cantonal EMS ("tablissements mdico-sociaux", also called "homes"; nursing homes). On 20th May 2020, the canton announced that the civil protection would progressively withdraw its members from the EMS from now on, and up until the month of June. NB: for the sake of the survey, we will consider 1st June 2020 as the end date for this policy (see the wording in the source), i.e. that the civil protection will have withdrawn the totality of its members by 1st June 2020. UPDATE: The original mobilization of the civil protection in the EMS didn't have an end date, but on 20th May 2020, the canton of Neuchtel announced that the civil protection would withdraw progressively from the EMS from now until the month of June (for the sake of the survey, we will consider that end date as 1st June 2020).
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Switzerland, Geneva--The canton announced May 24 that they will donate 50,000 francs to the city of Bukavu in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), in the context of COVID-19.

description: The canton Glarus established a central health testing center to test people on Covid-19. This policy was made to relieve the cantonal hospital. People can go to the test center after they registered via phone. A drive-in test facility is also included. This center was established on March 24, 2020. The testing facilities are closed on May 26. UPDATE: The testing facilities are closed on May 26.

description:
On June 12th, in Swiss Canton Basel City the Test Center in near the University Hospital in the Preachers Church was closed as the number of people willing to test has stabilized at a level that allows the operation of this outsourced test and triage center to be discontinued.

 UPDATE: The test center in the in the Preacher Church will be closed June 12th.
type: Health Resources

description:
On June 12th, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Basel City the opening of a smaller test center ( throat swabs) near the entrance of the University hospital during summer was announced starting June 15th. Opening hours Monday till Friday. 
On August 6th it was announced that the test center for suspected Covid 19 cases will again be available to the population 7 days a week from Saturday August 8th. 
A larger test center will be available again at Basel University Hospital from the end of August.

description: On July 3, the Swiss Canton Ticino announces the re-opening of two outpatients consultation centres "Covid-19 checkpoints" in Giubiasco and Mendrisio, which were closed on June 30. The decision was taken after rising numbers and events. UPDATE: Originally all outpatient consultation centres "Covid-19 checkpoints" have been closed on June 30. On July 3, the Swiss Canton Ticino announces the re-opening of the centres Giubiasco and Mendrisio, due to rising numbers and events.

description: The Canton Schaffhausen in Switzerland opens on March 25, 2020 a center for medical testing of individuals with typical COVID-19 symptoms. This policy is implemented by the public health department of the Canton Schaffhausen. This Center is runned by Schaffhausen' physicians and is supported by the Swiss civil defence and volunteers from the health sector. The testing capacities and contact tracing capacities have been enlarged. UPDATE: The testing capacities and the capacities for contact tracing should be enlargened, the public health department of the canton Schaffhausen said on July 8th. Responsible for the enlargement of the testing capacities is the Task-Force called "Kantonale Abklrungszentrum (KAZ). The opening hours of KAZ have been extended. Furthermore general practitioners and pharmacies are allowed to test people with symptoms. Moreover measures are planned when there might occur a superspreader event.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure
enforcer: Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The canton Schaffhausen announced the recall of contaminated face masks. The authorities said on July 10th 2020, that the face masks which were stocked in 2007 in case of a pandemic, are microbiologically contaminated. Citizens who have received those contaminated masks are going to be contacted by the "Kantonale Fhrungsorganisation (KFO). The old masks are going to be replaced with new ones.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The canton Schaffhausen in Switzerland applies contact tracing again to contact person who are tested positive on Covid-19. This policy was announced on May 7th 2020 and starts the same day. Bars and clubs are obliged to check the persons contact details by checking their ID's. UPDATE: Clubs and bars in the canton schaffhausen are obligated to check the validity of persons contact details by checking their ID's. The reason is the increasing number of infections which are caused by bigger groups in bars and clubs.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Swiss federal government recommended that cantons introduce a mask requirement in shops, but St. Gallen decided against this. Masks are not required in shops. However the canton recommends a mask when a distance of 1.5 meters is not possible in shops.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure

description: The Canton Schaffhausen in Switzerland opens on March 25, 2020 a center for medical testing of individuals with typical COVID-19 symptoms. This policy is implemented by the public health department of the Canton Schaffhausen. This Center is runned by Schaffhausen' physicians and is supported by the Swiss civil defence and volunteers from the health sector. UPDATE: Due to the rising numbers of infections during the holidays, the local health department of the canton Schaffhausen implemented a new testing concept. The new test concept should shorten the time between testing and telling the result to the tested person. Furthermore the capacities for contact tracing had been extended. Those planse were announced on August 7. UPDATE: Due to the rising numbers of infections during the holidays, the local health department of the canton Schaffhausen implemented a new testing concept. The new test concept should shorten the time between testing and telling the result to the tested person. Furthermore the capacities for contact tracing had been extended.

Masks are required on school buses (public transport), and for special teaching events, such as camps. The school is required to provide masks for public transport.

description: Switzerland, Geneva--In an announcement August 7, the Council of the State declared that surgical masks would be provided to students and employees of public schools at the secondary level for the first two weeks (10 workdays) of the course. So far 350,000 masks have been reserved for this purpose.
type: Health Resources

description: In Switzerland Canton Basel City it was announced on August 25 th that from Monday August 31st a larger test center will be available again at Basel University Hospital. This is currently being set up in the old swimming pool and will allow up to 700 swabs per day to be carried out.

description: The Canton Schaffhausen in Switzerland announced that it's hospital prepare a pre-triage to seperate persons with the Coronavirus from persons without the Virus. If the persons are tested positive they are put in Isolationfacilities inside the hospitals. The Canton Schaffhausen implemented this strategy due to the increasing number of positive tested persons in the Canton. This policy starts at March 9th 2020.

description: According to the announcement of March 12 and in accordance with the BAG recommendations, not all suspected COVID cases are being tested in the Canton of Zug. Tests are only necessary for people who show severe symptoms or have an increased risk of complications. In addition, tests will continue to be carried out on healthcare professionals and staff of nursing homes with mild respiratory diseases. Since March 9, the tests can be carried out in doctors' surgeries in the canton, although advance notification by telephone is mandatory. All other persons who experience symptoms of a possible respiratory disease (cough/respiratory complaints and fever) should stay at home for up to 24 hours after the symptoms have subsided and should only contact their family doctor by telephone or, if he or she cannot be reached, the emergency medical service if their state of health deteriorates.
type: Health Testing
type_sub_cat: NA

description: On March 13, the Swiss Canton Grisons announces that the Federal Office of Public Health does no longer carry out comprehensive tests. Only people with symptoms from risk groups and patients with particularly severe symptoms are tested. This policy is announced together with the declaration of the "extraordinary status" in the Canton.

The data collected will allow to estimate the spread of the new Coronavirus in Ticino and to follow its evolution in the coming months, and will therefore be able to contribute to the development and implementation of targeted measures to prevent and control the epidemic in the medium term.

description:
On February 24, the Swiss Canton Ticino reaffirms the federal list of recommendations of hygienic measures to prevent the spread of the Coronavirus:
-frequent hand washing
- limit touching one's face
- keep distance to sick people
- cough into tissues 
- wear masks only if one is sick
- stay at home in case of flue-symptoms
- avoid health facilities with influenza-like symptoms 
- not take antibiotics, if not prescribed 
- in case of doubt, one should not go to the hospital, but contact the family doctor or call the cantonal or federal hotline
type: Hygiene
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied
link: Coronavirus, nessuna misura restrittiva in Ticino

description:
In addition to federal regulations, as of March 3, 2020, the Swiss canton of Nidwalden imposed the following requirements on organizers of events with less than 200 participants:
A list of all participants and their contact information must be kept and submitted to the health authorities, sufficient facilities for hand washing must be provided, and an information sheet by the federal health authority must be publicly displayed during the event.
type: Hygiene
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 11, the Swiss Canton Ticino introduces sanitary measures in prisons, i.e. social distancing, the provision of disinfectant and 15 cells are reserved for prisoners who would have to quarantine in case they had contact with an infected person.
type: Hygiene
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied

description: On 12 March the Canton of Zug reminds of the BAG recommendation. In addition to regular hand washing, it is particularly important that sick people consistently stay at home. In addition, a distance of preferably two metres from other people should always be maintained if possible, for example when standing in line or in meetings.
type: Hygiene
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied

description: On March 13, the Swiss Canton Grisons recommends that the population should strictly adhere to the rules of hygiene and social distancing in interpersonal relationships.
type: Hygiene
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied

description: On March 26, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health issued guidelines for burials of those who died on Covid 19.
type: Hygiene
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied

description: On March 31, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg published guidelines with hygiene procedures to be followed in dealing with persons at the end of their lives, as well as in the case of death and burials. The guidelines outline hygiene measures to be taken to allow visits of the relatives of the affected person.
type: Hygiene
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied

description: On May 7, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg published a press release recommending the wearing of masks, and showing the right use of one, as an additional measure for situations where in public places the social distancing and hygiene measures cannot be complied with. Specifically mentioned are public transport and shops, while an emphasis is placed on the continuous respect of other hygiene measures even when a mask is worn.
type: Hygiene
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied

description: On July 1 the Government of Canton Thurgau has announced the recommendation to wear face masks, especially in situations when social distancing is impossible (in public transport)
type: Hygiene
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied

description: On July 17, the State Council of the Swiss Canton of Fribourg recommended the wearing of masks in shops and stores with more than 10 people inside. While this is a recommended measure, the State Council announces that it may become compulsory, should the health situation worsen.
type: Hygiene
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied

description: As the protection concepts of some industry associations are not entirely clear, the Canton of Zug, Switzerland, government council has therefore decreed that masks must be worn for all services involving physical contact or where the minimum distance cannot be maintained. This concerns, among others, hairdressing salons, tattoo studios, cosmetic studios or massage parlors. The obligation to wear masks applies to all those present, i.e. both customers and employees. Not covered by these rules are stores or restaurants, as there is no physical contact and the minimum distance can be maintained.
type: Hygiene
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied

description:
On March 31, 2020 in Switzerland the Governments of Canton Ticino and Canton Grisons reaffirmed the call to second-home owners and tourists to limit their mobility to a minimum and, as far as possible, refrain from moving into their apartments, especially during Easter.
In order to convey this important message, a special leaflet has been created in Italian and German, shared with Ticino Turismo, which will be distributed by the police on the cantonal territory and outside the canton. UPDATE: Originally the Ticino population was asked to reduce travelling, then residents of a second home in Ticino were required to report, now a common urgend appeal of Canton Ticino and Canton Grisons is launched reiterating the invitation to tourists and owners of secondary homes to limit their movements and the occupation of holiday homes to a minimum, especially during the Easter period.

description: On 4th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel encouraged the EMS ("tablissement mdico-sociaux"; nursing homes) in the canton to ban, or at least limit visits to residents in order to protect them from coronavirus. It recommends as well that families of residents refrain from visiting their close ones in EMS if they have symptoms or come back from a high-risk region.

type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description:
On March 6, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Basel-City the Departement of Health has made recommendations for care homes on how to deal with visitors.
Residents of nursing homes cannot be expected not to receive a visit from their relatives and friends during the expected duration of the spread of the coronavirus. The health department therefore recommends that nursing homes limit visiting times and go through a well-developed health checklist with every visitor. If one question is answered with "yes", the person should be advised to postpone the visit.
type: Lockdown
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: On 6th March 2020, the hospital network (RHNe) of the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel decided to limit visits to patients to close family and partners only. Upon discussion with the doctors in charge, exceptions will be made for patients reaching the end of their life and for children in the pediatrics department.

description: On 6th March 2020, the hospital network (RHNe) of the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel decided to limit visits to patients to close family and partners only. Upon discussion with the doctors in charge, exceptions will also be made for patients reaching the end of their life and for children in the pediatrics department. On 10th March 2020, the canton decided to ban all visits except in 3 cases: 1) for families of people reaching the end of their life 2) for parents of hospitalized children 3) for visits upon request from medical staff. description: On 4th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel encouraged the EMS ("tablissement mdico-sociaux"; nursing homes) in the canton to ban, or at least limit visits to residents in order to protect them from coronavirus. It recommends as well that families of residents refrain from visiting their close ones in EMS if they have symptoms or come back from a high-risk region. On 17th March 2020, the cantonal doctor issued a directive banning all visits in EMS, except in cases of emergency (to be assessed by the EMS supervisors). On 23rd March 2020, the cantonal doctor issued a directive reaffirming the ban on visits in EMS, but adding exceptions to this measure. Visits are only allowed in cases of emergency, especially when residents are reaching the end of their life, or when the visit happens in a specific visiting room validated by the cantonal public health office (SCSP). UPDATE: The previous compliance of the policy was mandatory with one exception (cases of emergency), but on 23rd April 2020, the canton added some exceptions to this (still) mandatory measure.

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau decided that from the 11th of May on Aargau will lift the basic ban on visits and introduce a controlled right to visit.
Visitors must log in and register for traceability. A health checklist must also be completed. The visit must take place in controlled and protected meeting areas. The management of the institution defines the exact framework in the form of a visitation concept.

Visits to acute hospitals are still prohibited. In certain cases the management can authorize visits. Publicly accessible restaurants or cafeterias of acute hospitals remain closed to outside parties while the ones of the psychiatries and nursing homes are allowed to open with a protection concept. Psychiatries allow controlled visits.

Rehabilitation clinics and nursing homes allow controlled visit if the clinic/ home management considers relaxation based on the patient population and the current situation to be justifiable. Otherwise the regulation applies analogously to the acute hospitals.
The publicly accessible restaurants or cafeterias are allowed to open with a protection concept, provided that the rehabilitation clinic management considers the opening to be reasonable due to the patient population and the current situation.
There is still a basic ban on visits in nursing homes, with exceptions that the management can approve e.g. relatives can visit a dying person.
type: Lockdown
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: On 6th March 2020, the hospital network (RHNe) of the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel decided to limit visits to patients to close family and partners only. Upon discussion with the doctors in charge, exceptions will be made for patients reaching the end of their life and for children in the pediatrics department. On 10th March 2020, the canton decided to ban all visits except in 3 cases: 1) for families of people reaching the end of their life 2) for parents of hospitalized children 3) for visits upon request from medical staff. On 14th May 2020, the RHNe added an exception to the list of allowed visits: in the maternity ward, partners / husbands can now accompany their spouses during prenatal examinations and they can now visit their spouses (and the baby) after they have given birth. UPDATE: The original ban on visits in the Neuchtel hospital network (RHNe) was mandatory with only 3 exceptions (family of dying people, parents of hospitalized children and visits upon request from medical staff). But on 14th May 2020, the RHNe relaxed the compliance of this policy by adding an exception to the list of allowed visits: in the maternity ward, partners / husbands can now accompany their spouses during prenatal examinations and they can now visit their spouses (and the baby) after they have given birth.
