description:
On 4th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel encouraged the EMS ("tablissement mdico-sociaux"; nursing homes) in the canton to ban, or at least limit visits to residents in order to protect them from coronavirus. It recommends as well that families of residents refrain from visiting their close ones in EMS if they have symptoms or come back from a high-risk region. On 17th March 2020, the cantonal doctor issued a directive banning all visits in EMS, except in cases of emergency (to be assessed by the EMS supervisors). On 23rd April 2020, the cantonal doctor issued a directive reaffirming the ban on visits in EMS, but adding exceptions to this measure. Visits are only allowed in cases of emergency, especially when residents are reaching the end of their life, or when the visit happens in a specific visiting room validated by the cantonal public health office (SCSP). On 20th May 2020, the canton formally announced that visits in EMS would resume shortly (on 25th May 2020), thus ending the original policy.

NB: the date of the 25th May was announced earlier - on 8th May 2020 -, but the definitive measures were only confirmed on 20th May 2020. UPDATE: The original ban on visits didn't have an end date, but on 20th May 2020 the canton of Neuchtel announced that visits would be allowed again from 25th May 2020 on, thus ending the original policy.
type: Lockdown
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On 28th of May the Kanton special staff ("Sonderstab") ended the general lockdown of hospitals, elderly homes and homes for the handicappped. But only homes and institutions which require the following conditions are now allowed to reopen:
-they must have a safety concept
-no people who had contact to COVID-19 infected people are allowed in
-only patients who are able to abeit to hygiene and social distancing laws are allowed to leave the instituin or home alone.
If those conditions are not met they are not allowed to reopen. If neccessary, the managements of homes and institutions are allowed to close down again.
type: Lockdown
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: On 13th of March 2020 the Uri special staff ("Sonderstab") decreed a visiting ban for the Kanton hospital, all nursing homes, all retirement homes, all homes for the handicapped until 30th of April. Exemptions can be made by the Kanton hospital for partners of parturients, parents, affiliated people of a dying person. The policy was prolonged to 31st of May but ended earlier on 28th of May. UPDATE: The first update of the policy was supposed to last until 31st of May but the policy was already ended on 28th of May.
type: Lockdown
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: On June 5th, the government of the Swiss Canton of Solothurn announced that hospitals would have to develop a hygiene concept to allow visitors. Minimum requirements include visitor identification and recording, not more than two visitors at shared rooms at a time and visitors following the same hygienic measures as healthcare staff (e.g. wearing masks). The policy was scheduled to start on June 6th.

description: Since May 11, 2020, visits to hospitals, elderly homes, and facilities for people with disabilities in Appenzell Innerrhoden, Switzerland, are allowed under certain conditions, including mandatory registration before the visit, and limited visiting time, while also being limited to specially created visiting zones within the facility. These zones are to be disinfected after each visit. This order is set to at least remain until June 30, 2020.
type: Lockdown
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: On June 6th, 2020, the Swiss canton of Appenzell Innerrhoden has further lifted the original restriction on visits to hospitals, elderly homes, and facilities for people with disabilities. Visits do not longer need to be pre-registered, however, all visitors need to register at the entrance, record their personal information, and verify that they do not show any Covid-19 symptoms. Public cafeterias and restaurants within the facilities are allowed to reopen under the condition that they meet the general health advice and guarantee for social distance.

description: On 8th June 2020, the RHNe announced visits could resume under conditions in its centers of Pourtals and la Chaux-de-Fonds (more generally in all of its centers - see records 2360005 and 8718977 for the other centers)  from 9th June 2020 on. According to the new visiting regime, visits are limited to one visitor per day per patient, for one hour between 3pm and 5pm. The RHNe also added exceptions to this new visiting system: 1) the two parents can visit their children in the pediatrics department 2) the father and the siblings of a newborn can visit the mother and the baby at the maternity ward 3) more visits can be allowed for dying people or patients in intensive care.
type: Lockdown
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: On 20th May 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel confirmed that visits in the RHNe (Neuchtel hospital network) were still banned in their centers of la Chaux-de-Fonds and Pourtals (i.e. their classic, intensive-care centers) up until at least 8th June 2020. Exceptions to this policy are: 1) patients coming for an appointment in the oncology, obstetrics and neurology departments 2) patients who have to be accompanied for health reasons 3) if the medical team determines that visits for a patient are necessary. On 8th June 2020, the RHNe announced that from 9th June 2020 on, visits could resume under conditions in the centers of la Chaux-de-Fonds and Pourtals, thus ending the original policy. UPDATE: The original ban on visits in the RHNe centers of la Chaux-de-Fonds and Pourtals was set to last until 8th June 2020 at least. On 8th June 2020, the RHNe announced that visits could resume under conditions in these two centers, thus ending the original policy.
type: Lockdown
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On 20th May 2020, the RHNe (hospital network) of the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel announced that on their center of la Chrysalide, visits will only be allowed upon decision from the medical team. This decision will be made on a case-by-case basis, depending on the patient's medical state. The medical team will also decide under which conditions visits are allowed for a patient. Only first-degree relatives will be allowed to visit patients. On 8th June 2020, the RHNe announced a new visiting regime for all of their centers (including la Chrysalide) from 9th June 2020 on: visits are limited to one visitor per day per patient, for one hour between 3pm and 5pm. It also added exceptions to this new visiting system: 1) the two parents can visit their children in the pediatrics department 2) the father and the siblings of a newborn can visit the mother and the baby at the maternity ward 3) more visits can be allowed for dying people or patients in intensive care. UPDATE: The original compliance of this policy was mandatory with exceptions (visits allowed by the medical team). On 8th June 2020, these exceptions were modified and expanded (time and number of visitors restrictions + exceptions for pediatrics department and maternity ward as well as for dying people).
type: Lockdown
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On 20th May 2020, the RHNe (hospital network) of the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel announced that visits could resume under conditions in the rehabilitation centers of Locle and Val-de-Ruz. Conditions are the following: patients are only allowed to receive one visitor per day for one hour between 4pm and 6pm. Each visitor will have to wear a mask and to disinfect his/her hands. Only first-degree relatives will be allowed to visit patients. On 8th June 2020, the RHNe announced that from 9th June 2020 on, visits were still limited to one visitor per day per patient, still for one hour but now between 3pm and 5pm. It also added exceptions to this new visits system: 1) the two parents can visit their children in the pediatrics department 2) the father and the siblings of a newborn can visit the mother and the baby at the maternity ward 3) more visits can be allowed for dying people or patients in intensive care. UPDATE: The original compliance of this policy was mandatory with exceptions (time and number of visitors restrictions). On 8th June 2020, these exceptions were modified (different time frame for visits) and expanded (exceptions for pediatrics department and maternity ward as well as for dying people).
type: Lockdown
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: From June 10, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg re-allowed visits to the Fribourg Network for Mental Health (FPNG), as well as the running of group therapies with social distancing measures.
type: Lockdown
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: From June 24, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg announced that visits of siblings to birth centres will be allowed again. Their number is restricted to 1 sibling at a time which needs to be accompanied and supervised by the other parent.
type: Lockdown
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: From June 29, the health task force of the Swiss Canton of Fribourg requires all care institutions to maintain hygiene and distancing measures, while the systematic control of all entries into the institutions is not required anymore. However, a physical barrier needs to be maintained at the entry and visitors will be traced. Residents are allowed to leave the facilities again as long as they or their relatives are able to abide by the hygiene and behavioural measures, and to identify contacts. Exceptional situations, such as the end of life, immune weakness, minors, etc., will be decided upon individually. The implementation of these measures will be supported by a mobile COVID-Team of care workers, representatives of the care institutions, of the municipalities, and of a doctor who will be in charge.
type: Lockdown
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: From May 9, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg eased the lockdown restrictions imposed upon care homes in the canton, allowing relatives of resident to visit again. Visits will only be allowed to residents without confirmed COVID-19 infection and without suspicion of having contracted the virus. In addition care homes will need to have a safety plan complying with health restrictions to limit infections, including clear restrictions on registration, reception, hours and duration of visits, allowed set of individuals for visits, follow up, and hygiene measures. The measures were further eased from June 29. UPDATE: From June 29, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg further eased the lockdown restrictions imposed upon care institutions.
type: Lockdown
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: From July 1, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg announced eased lockdown restrictions for its hospitals, clinics, and birth centres. Under the new restrictions, the number of visitors is limited to 1 per day, visitors will need to be free of symptoms, they need to abide by the federal hygiene and distancing measures, they need to abide by the specific guidelines of the responsible institution/department, and visitors need to register while institutions need to keep a visitor list in order to allow tracing in the case of an infection.
type: Lockdown
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: On 3rd July 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel recommended EMS ("tablissements mdico-sociaux", nursing homes) to restrict visits to residents in terms of number of visitors within the same timeframe and in terms of duration of visits, so as to protect residents from Covid-19.

UPDATE: Cantonal employees should return to work

description: The Swiss canton of Appenzell Innerrhoden has, on February 28, 2020, put in place a committee to proactively deal with a potential outbreak of COVID-19. It is comprised of the cantonal doctor, representatives of the health authorities, and representatives of the civil protection office, who will work closely with cantonal hospitals, as well as with the federal office for health.

description: The Swiss canton of Appenzell Innerrhoden has, on June 9th, 2020, announced that the committee that proactively dealt with consequences COVID-19 would no longer be necessary. The work of the committee terminated on June 19th. UPDATE: On June 9th, 2020, it was announced that the workings of the cantonal Covid-19 committee of Appenzell Innerrhoden, Switzerland, which has been working since early March on tackling issues arising from the virus outbreak, would no longer be necessary and have therefore been terminated.

description: On 4th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel activated the "Etat-major cantonal de conduite (EMCC)" (cantonal general staff) of the ORCCAN (Organisation cantonale de gestion de crise et de catastrophe; Cantonal organization for crisis and disaster management) in relation to the Covid-19 pandemic. The EMCC is able to issue directives to fight the pandemic and to commandeer all workers deemed necessary in that respect (especially health workers, teachers, civil service personnel, public transportation personnel and civil protection personnel).
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Justice,Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: On March 6, the State Council of the Swiss Canton of Fribourg installes a new COVID-19 Sanitary Leadership Body, with the purpose of coordinating all actors of the health sector in the Canton in order to attain an overview of the situation.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: On March 13, the State Council of the Swiss Canton of Fribourg installed the 'Kantonales Fhrungsorgan (KFO)', freely translated into 'Cantonal Steering Body', to be in charge of the monitoring and coordination of COVID-19-related policy measures and proposals for the State Council. The task force was in place until June 30, when its responsibilities were handed back to the ordinary structures of the State.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: The Canton of Zug formed 1) a tripartite delegation of the Government Council for strategic management and crisis management, consisting of Landammann Stephan Schleiss, Health Director Martin Pfister and Security Director Beat Villiger. 2) A "Corona-Stab" task force was formed. The Corona-Stab supported this delegation in its operational tasks from 13 March onwards. The core staff of the cantonal executive staff, which supported the cantonal government during the Corona crisis and coordinated the measures, will end its service on 10 June 2020. At the same time, the hotline of the Canton of Zug, which had been available to the population for more than three months to answer questions about the Corona crisis, will be discontinued.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description:
On March 16, the cantonal government of Obwalden announced the creation of a 'Cantonal Leadership Task Force' (Kantonaler Fhrungsstab, KFS) to support the relevant authorities.

Its tasks consist of coordinating measures, allocate contracts and orders, internal and external information, as well as serving as a point of contact for municipalities. In addition, it may be tasked with requesting assistance from civil protection or the military.

description:
On March 16, the cantonal government of Obwalden announced the creation of a 'Cantonal Leadership Task Force' (Kantonaler Fhrungsstab, KFS) to support the relevant authorities.

Its tasks consist of coordinating measures, allocate contracts and orders, internal and external information, as well as serving as a point of contact for municipalities. In addition, it may be tasked with requesting assistance from civil protection or the military. UPDATE: The task force 'Kantonaler Fhrungsstab' (Cantonal leadership task force) has ceased operations on May 31. It will be replaced by a specialised employee at the cantonal health authority.

type_text: The federal law of March 13 announced that construction sites and business remain open with security measures. However, due to the worsening situation in the Canton Swiss, the Cantonal government decided to not follow and closed all construction sites and businesses. On March 27, the Federal Government then decided that Cantons, under certain circumstances, could go further and take stricter restrictive measures if they applied for it. Ticino implemented the exception clause immediately.

description: On March 27, the Swiss Federal Government allowed Cantons under certain circumstances (insufficient capacities, elevated number of cross-border commuters) to temporarily restrict or stop the activity of entire economic sectors as opposed to the federal law. This policy was politicised as "Lex Ticino" as it was tailormade for its case.
type: Other Policy Not Listed Above
type_sub_cat: NA
type_text: The Swiss Federal Government issued a regulation which allowed Cantons that were especially affected by the pandemic and did not have sufficient resources to close or restrict further certain economic activities, even though the federal law was not restricting them. This policy was mainly targeted at the Swiss Canton Ticino, which decided to keep construction sites closed even though the Federal Government announced to keep them open. The policy thus allows Ticino to go implement stricter measures than the Federal Government.

description:
On 15th April 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel created a new organizational system for doctors' offices in order to separate Covid-19 suspect patients from other patients in need of regular medical monitoring. From 20th April 2020 on, 3 networks of doctors' offices are to be distinguished:

1) NETWORK A: only patients without Covid-19 who suffer from a chronic illness or another serious health problem requiring regular medical monitoring

2) NETWORK B (separated in 2 distinct channels): 
a. in the first channel, patients without Covid-19 who suffer from a chronic illness or another serious health problem requiring regular medical monitoring
b. in the second channel, patients suspect or diagnosed with Covid-19

3) NETWORK C: only patients suspect or diagnosed with Covid-19 who are presenting with aggravated symptoms
type: Other Policy Not Listed Above
type_sub_cat: NA
type_text: On 15th April 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel created a new organizational system for doctors' offices in order to separate Covid-19 suspect patients from other patients in need of regular medical monitoring. 3 networks of doctors' offices are then to be distinguished ; patients shall be directed to one or the other network depending on his Covid-19 symptoms (or absence of Covid-19 symptoms).
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On 15th April 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel created a new organizational system for doctors' offices in order to separate Covid-19 suspect patients from other patients in need of regular medical monitoring. From 20th April 2020 on, 3 networks of doctors' offices are to be distinguished:

1) NETWORK A: only patients without Covid-19 who suffer from a chronic illness or another serious health problem requiring regular medical monitoring

2) NETWORK B (separated in 2 distinct channels): 
a. in the first channel, patients without Covid-19 who suffer from a chronic illness or another serious health problem requiring regular medical monitoring
b. in the second channel, patients suspect or diagnosed with Covid-19

3) NETWORK C: only patients suspect or diagnosed with Covid-19 who are presenting with aggravated symptoms

Patients are to be directed in one or the other network depending on their needs (treatment for chronic illness or Covid-19).

description: On May 6th, the Bern Canton announced that it would give an economic incentive of 5 million francs to help develop Bernese technology to fight COVID-19. In addition, the government also released a loan of 1.7 million francs for testing on public transport.
type: Other Policy Not Listed Above
type_sub_cat: NA
type_text: The policy is monetary incentive given for tech R&D as well as loans.

description: On 25th May 2020, in light of the postponement of the municipal election (see record 2304992), the Swiss canton of Neuchtel decided to extend to the end of 2020 the term of office served by the municipal authorities elected in 2016. Their term and more generally the 2016-2020 administrative period are extended to 31st December 2020. However, the canton ruled that the municipal authorities elected in 2016 could decide to end the 2016-2020 administrative period between the election of the new municipal authorities on 25th October 2020 and the end of 2020.
type: Other Policy Not Listed Above
type_sub_cat: NA
type_text: Due to the postponement of the municipal election, the canton of Neuchtel extended to 31st December 2020 the term of office served by the current municipal authorities.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On 27th May 2020, the Department of Education and Family in the Swiss canton of Neuchtel decided to cancel all final exams for the "certificat d'cole de culture gnrale" (high-school level diploma) this year. An exception can be made for students who fail to graduate with the grades obtained throughout the year. These students have thus the possibility to take the exams.
type: Other Policy Not Listed Above
type_sub_cat: NA
type_text: On 27th May 2020, the canton of Neuchtel cancelled all final exams for the "certificat d'cole de culture gnrale", except for students who fail to graduate with continuous assessment grades.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On March 13th the Speical Task force of the Canton Uri prohibited the visit of people in hospitals and nurseries to protect the people living there.

May 26th: Policy will end at May 28th UPDATE: Policy is ended at May 28th.
type: Other Policy Not Listed Above
type_sub_cat: NA

description: In Switzerland, the Geneva Department of Economic Development (DDE) has agreed with the main retail chains in Geneva to offer food to those who need it most, organized from June 8 2020 to July 11 2020. The memorandum of understanding  signed between the major food retailers and the State of Geneva provides that the coordination of this additional aid will be carried out by the Partage Foundation. It is an extension of the "Caddy for All" action deployed under the aegis of RTS.
type: Other Policy Not Listed Above
type_sub_cat: NA
type_text: The Geneva Department of Economic Development cooperated with major retail chains in Geneva to offer additional aid to the people who most need it.

description: On June 18, the Swiss Canton Ticino launches an online survey on the communication (hotline, campaigns, etc. )of the cantonal authorities during the in the context of the Covid-19 health emergency. It aims at the whole population and can be taken online until June 25.
type: Other Policy Not Listed Above
type_sub_cat: NA
type_text: The Swiss Canton Ticino launches an online survey on the quality of communication in the context of the Covid-19 health emergency from June 18 until June 25

description:
On July 2nd, 2020 the government council of Swiss Canton Basel-City decided to hold the operators and organizers of facilities and events more accountable. They must now ensure the correctness of the collected visitor data by checking the identity card or in another way. A corresponding ordinance on additional measures will come into force on Monday, July 6, 2020 and will apply until December 31, 2020.
This does not apply to visitors of restaurants.

note: According to the federal regulation, organizers must collect visitor data if social distancing or the wearing of masks is not guaranteed.
type: Other Policy Not Listed Above
type_sub_cat: NA
type_text: ensuring the correctness of visitors data collected by organizers of events to ease contact tracing

description: On 29 January, the canton of Bern issues a press release that COVID-19 may spread in the area and issues recommendations on personal hygiene, do avoid contact with persons suffering from respiratory symptoms, and to avoid large crowds.
type: Public Awareness Measures
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On January 30, 2020 in Switzerland the Federal Office of Health launched a telephone-hotline to meet requiries concerning the new Coronavirus and to inform travellers about health risks related to Corona. this was announced January 29.
type: Public Awareness Measures

description: On February 24, 2020 in Switzerland the government of Canton Valais launched an information page on the website of the Health Service at https://www.vs.ch/covid-19 . This summarizes all relevant information for health professionals and the public and is updated as required.

type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description:
On February 24, 2020 The Swiss Federal government has decided to provide more information to the population  in connection with the coronavirus outbreak. 
Therefore an information campaign for travelers and commuters at the borders and airports was started. A second information campaign on personal protection measures "So schtzen wir uns" (Protect yourself and others) is aimed at the general public. In a first step, the FOPH would like to make three important hygiene and behavior rules known: Wash your hands thoroughly, cough and sneeze into a tissue or the crook of your arm, stay at home if you have fever or a cough.
type: Public Awareness Measures
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description: Switzerland, Geneva: February 28 at noon, the State of Geneva's dedicated COVID-19 phone-line will become active for the public to use to ask questions regarding COVID-19. This is an additional line citizens of the canton can use along with the national hotline.

description: On March 3, 2020 the Swiss FOPH announced that the campaign Protect yourself and others has been upgraded from yellow to red. In addition to the previous three hygiene rules: Wash your hands thoroughly. Cough and sneeze into a paper tissue or the crook of your arm. Stay home if you have a high temperature and a cough. There are three more rules: Avoid shaking hands. Always call ahead before going to the doctors or the emergency department. Dispose of used paper tissues in a sealed waste bin.They apply with immediate effect. Poster and Flyer can be downloaded from the FOPHs webside. UPDATE: On March 3, 2020 the Swiss FOPH announced that the campaign Protect yourself and others has been upgraded from yellow to red. In addition to the previous three hygiene rules there are three more rules.
type: Public Awareness Measures
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description: On February 28th, the government of the Swiss Canton Solothurn announced that organizers of events with 100 to 999 participants would have to conduct a risk assessment with the Canton government via a hotline. description: The Swiss Canton Ticino launches a new awareness campaign facing the second phase of reopening on May 11. The Campaign "Distanti ripartiamo" extends to "Mi proteggo, ti proteggo" recommends continuing to respect the rules of physical distance and increased hygiene as well as to keep one updated with the last materials provided by the Canton.
type: Public Awareness Measures

description: On May 8, amid the easing national lockdown from May 11, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg recommended to the public to maintain hygiene and distancing measures to prevent the spread of the virus, including to keep working from home, to walk, cycle, or to take public transport (whilst wearing a mask and maintain distancing).
type: Public Awareness Measures
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On May 8th, the Canton government announced the relaxation of previous health policies such as restrictions on doctor's visits, nursing home visits and other related medical practices. However, in addition screening will heavily increase along with an informational campaign.

description: On May 11, the Swiss Canton Ticino issues recommendations on the use of masks. Protective masks should be used in case of prolonged contact and where physical distances cannot be guaranteed. In cases where contact is short and distances are guaranteed, the mask is of no use. When, on the other hand, the distance cannot be guaranteed during short contacts, or in the case of prolonged contacts guaranteeing the distance, the mask can be useful.
type: Public Awareness Measures
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On May 20, the Swiss Canton Ticino releases and distributes a new awareness campaign especially for tourists Bentornati in Ticino! Distanti e responsabili anche in vacanza" with information and reminders of social distancing and hygiene measures that need to be followed.

description:
On June 22, the Swiss Canton Ticino clarifies that the use of air conditioning does not represent a risk factor for the spread of coronavirus. Furthermore advises on its use are given, such as to avoid
air recirculation function, regardless of the use of air conditioning, to regularly open the windows for a few minutes during the day to allow for air exchange, to keep the air flow of air conditioners in shared offices / spaces to a minimum, to avoid using monobloc removable air conditioners in shared offices / spaces.

description: On February 28th, the government of the Swiss Canton Solothurn announced that organizers of events with 100 to 999 participants would have to conduct a risk assessment with the Canton government via a hotline. This was scheduled to begin on February 29th. On March 4th, the Canton government announced that from that day on, the lower participant bound would be changed from 100 to 150. As part of the national government's ban on events for more than 100 participants, the Canton government announced on March 13th, that the requirement of such risk assessment would end on the same day. UPDATE: The policy was established on February 29th (and updated on March 4th). As part of the national government's ban on events of >100 participants, the requirement for event organizers to contact the Canton government automatically ended on March 13th.
type: Public Awareness Measures
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On April 1, the COVID-19 leadership body (KFO) of the Swiss Canton of Fribourg announced that the selling of seeds, saplings, and potting soil would be allowed under restrictions. These include to online-sales with delivery, drive-in systems with strict distancing and without causing traffic disruption, the closure of access to stores and greenhouses, mandatory orders in advance (online, via telephone or email), the avoidance of payments by cash, and the arrangement of exact timings to pick up the product. This measures eases the federal restriction of non-essential businesses from the 13 March 2020 due to the demand among the population.

description: On April 9, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg allowed the re-opening of markt stalls in public places under the following conditions: The measure only concerns stalls that sell groceries, the distance between stalls in public places needs to be between 50-80 meters, the staff needs to ensure physical distancing of 2 meters in the queue, municipalities decide the days when market stalls are allowed while usual opening times can be extended to reduce the numbers of customers, municipalities need to ensure fair treatment of all merchants, and the cantonal police will be controlling. When these conditions apply, market stalls can only be opened in places where usually markets take place regularly.

description:
On 24th April 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel announced a series of requirements for the partial reopening of businesses (scheduled by the Swiss Federal Council on 27th April 2020 - see the policy coded on the federal level). Businesses allowed to reopen have to define a protection scheme for clients and personnel in compliance with the federal recommendations. The scheme has to encompass hygiene and social distancing rules as well as protection for vulnerable populations. Controls will be conducted to ensure compliance with requirements. If the protection scheme is deemed insufficient, cantonal authorities can prevent a business to reopen. If a business doesn't comply with its protection scheme, cantonal authorities can force a business to close.

NB: the businesses allowed to reopen (according to the federal policy) are: personal grooming stores (hair salons, tattoo salons...), hardware stores, florists, garden centers and self-service businesses (carwash, plant nurseries...).
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

personal grooming ( hairdresser, massage studios, tattoo studios); garden center, florists and nurseries; Do-it-yourself shops; self-service facilities ( car-washing, solarium, pick-your-own-crops).
All business have to follow a protection protocoll including hygienic measures, hand sanitation for customers, allowing social distancing. For personal grooming masks are obligatory, in shops not more than one customer per 10 qm is allowed.

description:
On April 29, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council announced the second step of easing business restrictions starting May 11. 
All shops, retail business and markets are allowed to reopen according to their protection concept ( one customers per 10 qm, compliance to the guidelines of the Federal Office of Health in regard of social distancing, hygiene).
Private museum and private libraries may open according to their protection concept.
Restaurants and bars can take the first step of resumption: only for seated consumption, groups of up to 4 per table, distance between tables, closure from midnight to 6 am, no live musik or events, masks recommended for employees

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau will open from the May 12 on, all locations of the Museum Aargau. The castles Lenzburg, Wildegg, Hallwyl and Habsburg, the Vindonissa Legionnaire's Trail, the Vindonissa Museum and the Knigsfelden Monastery welcome visitors.
The Museum Aargau opens the locations in compliance with a protection concept that builds on the rules and regulations of the federal government. In addition to disinfectants and floor markings for the minimum distance, a limited number of visitors are allowed to enter the premises. Wherever possible, the entrances and exits as well as tours of the museum are separated by direction. Only a few areas in which the distance and hygiene rules (among other things for structural reasons) cannot be observed remain temporarily closed.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: On May 15th, in agreement with other prefectures, has allowed establishments and businesses to extend their terraces to allow more patrons while following outside only restrictions. However this is to be done under strict guidelines for safety and convenience.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description:
On May 27, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council is easing most of the remaining business restrictions as of 6 June. 
All leisure and entertainment businesses such as casinos, amusement parks, cinema, theatre, discos may reopen, as can swimming pools and spas. Strip clubs may also reopen and services offered by sex workers may resume. Hygiene and social distancing rules must still be observed. If it is not possible to respect social distancing rules, contact tracing must be assured, e.g.by means of attendance lists.
For groups of more than four people restaurants it is required to take the contact details of one guest per table.Customers may still only be served when seated. All establishments, discos and nightclubs are required to close at midnight and may not admit more than 300 people a night. Discos are limited to one customer per 4 qm.
.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: On July 8, 2020, the Swiss canton of Basel-City announced that despite a federal limit of 300 people in gastronomical establishments (including bars, clubs and discos), it would lower this limit to 100 people if protective measures such as social distancing or mask-wearing cannot be guaranteed. Multiple closed sectors with a maximum of 100 people each can be established.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau the cantonal medical service implemented that from the 9th of july on per bar or club only 100 people will be allowed.
Furthermore, events with over 100 and up to 1000 people must be divided into sectors with a maximum of 100.
The measures ordered are limited and apply from Thursday, July 9, 2020, 6 p.m. to Sunday, August 16, 2020, midnight.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: On July 8th, the government of the Swiss Canton Solothurn announced that bar, club and restaurant owners would have to identify and record all visitors and verify the provided data. Furthermore, the maximum number of visitors would be limited to 100 if neither social distancing nor hygienic measures could be enforced. However, multiple seperated rooms for 100 people each would be allowed. This policy would take into effect on July 9th and expire on August 31st.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description: Basel-Landschaft (Switzerland) restricts visitor numbers in bars and night clubs to 100 from July 9.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau the cantonal medical service implemented that from the 9th of july on per bar or club only 100 people will be allowed.
Furthermore, events with over 100 and up to 1000 people must be divided into sectors with a maximum of 100.
The measures ordered are limited and apply from Thursday, July 9, 2020, 6 p.m. to Sunday, August 16, 2020, midnight.
On August 13, 2020, this policy was extended until the end of September 2020.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: On July 10, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, tightens the rules for registering guests to clubs and bars so that contact tracing is guaranteed in case of an infection. Business owners of bars, clubs, and dance halls, are required to report the name and address of their establishment to the cantonal medical office, including three additional contact persons. Before admission, guests are required to register with their full name, address, phone number, and email addresses with proof of identity. Business owners/contact persons must be available between 7-10am and ensure that the electronic guest list is sent to the cantonal medical office on request.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description:
On 10 Juli the Regierungsrat Kanton Zug decided to add the following restrictions to the national measures: In the interiors of restaurants, including bars and clubs as well as discotheques and dance halls, a maximum of 30 guests may be present at any one time. In the entire guest area of these establishments, including any outdoor areas, a maximum of 100 guests may be present at any one time. The outdoor areas must be clearly recognisable or marked. The contact data must be recorded, regardless of whether the guests enter the interior of the holding or stay only in outside areas ten. 
The decision shall enter into force on 13 July and is in force until 31 August.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: Swiss canton Valais restricts bars, night clubs and all facilities closing later than midnight: Only 100 people are allowed after 8 pm from July 16. For contact tracing, data of the clients as well as time of entry and exit are to be collected. The data is to be checked via personal ID card and a control call on the mobile phone.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: On July 15, 2020, the Swiss canton of Lucerne announced that despite a federal limit of 300 people in gastronomical services (including bars and discos), it would lower the limit of people to 100 if the consumption does not only take place at an assigned table, or if protective measures such as social distancing, mask-wearing, etc, can not be guaranteed.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: On July 16, the Swiss Canton Ticino announces the extension of the measures until August 09, i.e. the restriction of people of 100 in restaurants, bars and night clubs between 18.00 until their closure. Furthermore, night clubs and establishments where consumption occurs standing are obliged to collect data of their customers. UPDATE: The original measures were supposed to end on July 19, however they were extended until August 09
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: From July 20, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg requires bars, clubs and open-air bars to adhere to the protective measures and to ensure better tracking of customers. Therefore, they will be required to demand at least one ID card and mobile phone number of a group of customers.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: On 24 July, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, closes the club "Capital Bollwerk" following an outbreak of corona among guests on 18-19 July
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: As of Tuesday July 28 in Geneva, Switzerland, customers must wear a mask in shops, as well as by staff when the latter cannot benefit from another protection system (eg glass or plexiglass). The managers of facilities and establishments open to the public must, from Tuesday July 28, 2020, provide their customers with a hydro-alcoholic solution. They must also ensure that no one enters their premises without prior disinfection of the hands. These measures will apply until October 1, 2020, with the possibility of being extended depending on the situation.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: From Friday July 31 in Geneva, Switzerland, establishments accessible to the public and equipped for dancing, with drinking and catering facilities, such as dance halls, cabaret-dancings, discos and nightclubs are closed until August 23, 2020 inclusive. The closure may be prolonged depending on the epidemiological evolution.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description:
From July 31 2020 in Geneva, Switzerland, Customers in bars and restaurants must consume while remaining seated. Interpersonal distances must be respected. This measure is required until 23 August 2020 inclusive and may be extended depending on the epidemiological evolution.

The compulsory mask is now extended to customers of restaurants and bars (including on the terraces) during any movement in the space of the establishment, including for take-out. The client can remove his mask as soon as he is seated.

The operators of bars and similar establishments have the obligation to collect the identity and a reliable means of contact of the customers. 

Violation of these measures may be punished with a fine.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: On July 3, the Swiss Canton Ticino announces restriction of people of 100 in restaurants, bars and night clubs between 18.00 until their closure. Furthermore, night clubs and establishments where consumption occurs standing are obliged to collect data of their customers. The measures have immediate effect until July 19. UPDATE: On August 06, the Swiss Canton Ticino extends the current measures in place until August 24, i.e. a maximum of 100 guests overall over the entire evening, between 6.00 pm and closing time, and the obligation to collect customer personal data and verify them.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: On August 12 the Government of Canton Thurgau has announced that from August 14, 2020, the operators of bars and clubs in the canton of Thurgau are obliged to record the contact details of their guests before entering the restaurant and to verify this with an official ID.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: On 13 August, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, announces that beginning on 17 August new measures will be implemented regarding contact tracing in restaurants. The new measures will oblige one guest per party to register their name, birthday, email address, and cell number. This measure is only relevant for guests seated inside the restaurant. It is not mandatory for outdoor guests.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: On July 3, the Swiss Canton Ticino announces restriction of people of 100 in restaurants, bars and night clubs between 18.00 until their closure. Furthermore, night clubs and establishments where consumption occurs standing are obliged to collect data of their customers. The measures have immediate effect until July 19. UPDATE: On August 19, the Swiss Canton Ticino extends the current measures in place until September 07, i.e. a maximum of 100 guests overall over the entire evening, between 6.00 pm and closing time, and the obligation to collect customer personal data and verify them.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: From August 22nd onwards, the Canton of Zug, Switzerland, decided, events with 100 persons or more may only be held if the minimum distance can be maintained or masks are worn. In return, up to 100 people are again allowed in the interior areas of clubs and bars at the same time, which means that the same rules apply to all establishments and events.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: The Canton Zug decided that from August 22nd onwards, events for 100 people or more may only be held if the minimum distance can be maintained or masks are worn. In return, up to 100 people are again allowed in the indoor areas of clubs and bars at the same time, so that the same rules apply to all establishments and events.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: In Zurich (Switzerland) all gastronomic businesses must register contact data of customers from August 24.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: Swiss canton Zurich implements a limit of 100 people in clubs from August 24.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: On July 3, the Swiss Canton Ticino announces restriction of people of 100 in restaurants, bars and night clubs between 18.00 until their closure. Furthermore, night clubs and establishments where consumption occurs standing are obliged to collect data of their customers. The measures have immediate effect until July 19. UPDATE: On September 02, the Swiss Canton Ticino extends the current measures in place until September 21, i.e. a maximum of 100 guests overall over the entire evening, between 6.00 pm and closing time, and the obligation to collect customer personal data and verify them.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: In the middle of February, the canton of Bern, Switzerland,  placed a number of restrictions on persons visiting prisons. This included prohibiting touching, and mandating mask usage, or having the visit take place behind a separating glass panel.

description: On March 12, the Swiss Canton Ticino closes its cantonal public libraries. The foreseen reopening on the end of March was extended until May 11, where they could open their doors for loan services. The whole library, including reading rooms, reopened on June 8.

description:
On March 15,2020 in Switzerland the Government of Canton Jura 
closed all cantonal and communal administration counters from March 16. Exceptions may be allowed by heads of departments, respectively by competent municipal authorities, in order to guarantee imperative services to the population. Contacts by telecommunication or by post are preferred.

description: On March 16, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, ordered all public service counters to close, including the department of motorvehicles. The department (Strassenverkehrs-und Schifffahrtsarm or SVSA) instead now provides courier services for original documents, as well as online and analog services. On 11 May, counters reopen for service. UPDATE: Counters reopen on 11 May

description: On March 16, the Office for the Labour Market (Amt fr den Arbeitsmarkt) of the Swiss Canton of Fribourg announced the closure of its facilities to the public, while all its services would remain available via telephone, post, or email. The measure lasted until the re-opening of regional job centres (RAVs) on June 2.

type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: On 16th March 2020, the crisis management task force (ORCCAN) of the Swiss canton of Neuchtel announced the centralization of police services. From 17th March 2020 on, the public can access police counters in only 3 police stations: Neuchtel - BAP, La Chaux-de-Fonds - SISPOL and Fleurier. The other police stations will be closed to the public (although some will remain available by phone).
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Justice,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On 16th March 2020, the crisis management task force (ORCCAN) of the Swiss canton of Neuchtel announced the centralization of police services. From 17th March 2020 on, the public can access police counters in only 3 police stations: Neuchtel - BAP, La Chaux-de-Fonds - SISPOL and Fleurier. The other police stations will be closed to the public (although some will remain available by phone).
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

description: On 17th March 2020, the board of the Grand Conseil (parliament) in the Swiss canton of Neuchtel decided to cancel the  24th/25th March 2020 parliamentary session due to the Covid-19 pandemic. All parliamentary committees' activities are also suspended until further notice. An assessment of the situation will be conducted by 19th April 2020 to decide whether or not the Grand Conseil can safely resume its activities.

type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: As of March 20, Ticino enables the cantonal administration and municipal and judicial authorities to reorganize themselves while aiming at limiting as much as possible their activities. They are encouraged to only hold administrative and civil proceedings including urgent, essential, mandatory and important decisions which ensure the proper functioning of the cantonal and municipal administrations in this particular period.

description: Ticino announces on March 20 the suspension off all non-essential and non-urgent judicial sessions while allowing judicial authorities to reorganize themselves. This policy will be in place until April 19. UPDATE: Ticino banned the public from attending civil hearings and criminal proceeding as of March 12. Starting from March 20 all non-essential judicial sessions will be suspended until April 19.

type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description:
On March 20, 2020 in Switzerland the Federal Coucil announced that the following statutory deadlines stand still as of March 21 till may 31:
- Deadline for submitting signature lists for a popular initiative 
- Deadline for the treatment of popular initiatives
- Deadline for the submission of a popular initiative 
The following actions are not carried out during the standstill.
- Disposal of the creation of referenda
- Popular vote on a federal referendum
The collection of signatures is prohibited.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

- Popular vote on a federal referendum
The collection of signatures is prohibited.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description:
On March 20, 2020 in Switzerland the Federal Coucil announced that the following statutory deadlines stand still as of March 21 till may 31:
- Deadline for submitting signature lists for a popular initiative 
- Deadline for the treatment of popular initiatives
- Deadline for the submission of a popular initiative 
The following actions are not carried out during the standstill.
- Disposal of the creation of referenda
- Popular vote on a federal referendum
The collection of signatures is prohibited.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: The Swiss Canton Grisons holds the June session of the Grand Council as announced on March 23. The session takes place in the Chur town hall and not as usual in the Grand Council building. The town hall is the only space where social distancing can be guaranteed. No audience is admitted to the session, but a live stream will enable all Council negotiations to be followed directly.

The session takes place in the Chur town hall and not as usual in the Grand Council building. The town hall is the only space where social distancing can be guaranteed. No audience is admitted to the session, but a live stream will enable all Council negotiations to be followed directly.

description:
On March 20, 2020, the Swiss canton of Nidwalden announced that government offices would have to close their counter services to citizens by March 23, if social distancing is impossible to maintain. However, they are still able to handle requests by telephone or e-mail, as well as in person upon appointment.

Essential government offices where social distancing is possible continue to operate their counters at reduced opening hours.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description:
On March 20, 2020, the Swiss canton of Nidwalden announced that government offices would have to close their counter services to citizens by March 23, if social distancing is impossible to maintain. However, they are still able to handle requests by telephone or e-mail, as well as in person upon appointment.

Essential government offices where social distancing is possible continue to operate their counters at reduced opening hours. UPDATE: On May 15, it was announced that regular opening hours at service counters of the cantonal administration would be resumed beginning on May 18. The only exception is the office of public unemployment insurance and regional employment agency at Hergiswil, which will remain closed until June 8.

description:
On 15th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel ordered the closure of all public places providing recreational services, including public museums and public swimming-pools, until 30th April 2020. On 23rd March 2020, the Canton abrogated the order which comprised this policy, thus ending it earlier than expected.

NB: this abrogation is probably related to the federal order closing all non-essential public places on 16th March 2020 (following the declaration of "extraordinary situation").
 UPDATE: The original closure of public places providing recreational services was set to last until 30th April 2020, but the Neuchtel state council abrogated the order which comprised this policy on 23rd March 2020.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description:
On 15th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel ordered the closure of all public places providing recreational services, including public museums and public swimming-pools, until 30th April 2020. On 23rd March 2020, the Canton abrogated the order which comprised this policy, thus ending it earlier than expected.

NB: this abrogation is probably related to the federal order closing all non-essential public places on 16th March 2020 (following the declaration of "extraordinary situation").
 UPDATE: The original closure of public places providing recreational services was set to last until 30th April 2020, but the Neuchtel state council abrogated the order which comprised this policy on 23rd March 2020.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: On 25th March 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel suspended all statutory time limits for submitting requests for referenda and popular initiatives on cantonal and communal matters. Moreover, the canton suspended the issuance of certificates of eligibility to vote ("attestation de la qualit d'lecteur") for each request (i.e. the validation of signatures: the administration double-checks that each person who signed the request is eligible to vote and issues a document certifying the number of eligible people who have signed the request). During this suspension, signatures cannot be collected for a prospective petition (referenda or initiatives). The statutory time limits for processing requests is also suspended. All these measures are set to last until 31st May 2020.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: On March 25, Ticino recommends collecting certain waste, such as masks, tissues, hygiene items, etc. in a separate well-closed plastic bag after their use and then in the municipal waste bag. In the case of sick or quarantined people, separate waste collection is suspended, every waste (including plastic, aluminium, paper, vegetables, etc) has to be put in the same bag. The bag has to be brought by third parties to the collection points, otherwise, the municipality can be contacted.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: On March 24, the Swiss Canton Grisons issues a general fire ban on the entire canton area in connection with the coronavirus with immediate effect. The Graubnden government council assumes that it is currently not possible to have enough helicopter pilots and emergency services in the event of a forest fire.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: On March 18, 2020, the Swiss canton of Nidwalden announced that a session of the state council / parliament scheduled for April 1 would be cancelled. UPDATE: On April 21, it was announced that the parliament would re-open for the scheduled session on May 27. The session originally scheduled for May 6 would be cancelled to comply with federal restrictions, though.

type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau decided that the deadline for submitting the tax return 2019 is extended until June 30 for employed people and until September 30, 2020 for self-employed people and farmers.
The deadline for submitting the 2019 tax return for legal entities will be extended until September 30, 2020. There is no need to submit a deadline extension.
For tax claims, a reminder and debt enforcement stop applies until June 30, 2020.
Official deadlines set by the tax authorities for the submission of additional documents can be extended upon request. The tax authorities treat such requests with goodwill.
From March 1, 2020 to December 31, 2020, in the event of late payment of the cantonal and municipal tax due in this period, no default interest is due.

If a company is bankrupt or must close because of corona, a provision can be made in the 2019 annual financial statements.

The Department of Finance and Resources can deviate from legal deadlines in cases of liquidity shortage and difficulties in complying with procedural obligations with the tax law.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

For tax claims, a reminder and debt enforcement stop applies until June 30, 2020.
Official deadlines set by the tax authorities for the submission of additional documents can be extended upon request. The tax authorities treat such requests with goodwill.
From March 1, 2020 to December 31, 2020, in the event of late payment of the cantonal and municipal tax due in this period, no default interest is due.

If a company is bankrupt or must close because of corona, a provision can be made in the 2019 annual financial statements.

The Department of Finance and Resources can deviate from legal deadlines in cases of liquidity shortage and difficulties in complying with procedural obligations with the tax law.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau decided that from the 2nd of April on if a business for which the municipal assembly or the residents' council is responsible does not allow a postponement, it will become directly subject to the ballot box.
In the explanations of the vote, the municipal council must also explain why the business does not tolerate postponement.

type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description:
From the 2nd of April on there will be public social assistance prevention measures. Accordingly, the regulations for responsibilities for case management and assistance changed.
If a municipal or regional social service is unable to perform its duties the municipality has to provide a temporary solution. 
If they cant, the cantonal social service can temporarily transfer responsibility for case management and assistance to another local/ regional social service or another suitable agency.
It takes over the case management and assistance in accordance with the legal requirements applicable in its municipality, if this one is not able to fulfill its duties another appropriate body takes over.
The original municipality has to bear the expenses incurred by the newly responsible institution.
The cantonal social service can take appropriate coordination measures and regulate uniform criteria for assuming responsibility in an instruction.

Requests for the granting of cost credits for medical purposes that do not tolerate a delay are to be treated as appropriate and the associated payments as quickly as possible to do.

The cantonal social service can oblige the municipal and regional social services to take over the management of the case for the duration of the ongoing jurisdictional procedure.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
enforcer: Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

Requests for the granting of cost credits for medical purposes that do not tolerate a delay are to be treated as appropriate and the associated payments as quickly as possible to do.

The cantonal social service can oblige the municipal and regional social services to take over the management of the case for the duration of the ongoing jurisdictional procedure.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
enforcer: Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
From the 2nd of April on there will be public social assistance prevention measures. Accordingly, the regulations for responsibilities for case management and assistance changed.
If a municipal or regional social service is unable to perform its duties the municipality has to provide a temporary solution. 
If they cant, the cantonal social service can temporarily transfer responsibility for case management and assistance to another local/ regional social service or another suitable agency.
It takes over the case management and assistance in accordance with the legal requirements applicable in its municipality, if this one is not able to fulfill its duties another appropriate body takes over.
The original municipality has to bear the expenses incurred by the newly responsible institution.
The cantonal social service can take appropriate coordination measures and regulate uniform criteria for assuming responsibility in an instruction.

Requests for the granting of cost credits for medical purposes that do not tolerate a delay are to be treated as appropriate and the associated payments as quickly as possible to do.

The cantonal social service can oblige the municipal and regional social services to take over the management of the case for the duration of the ongoing jurisdictional procedure.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
enforcer: Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau decided that from the 2nd of April on
when electing the local council, a silent election is possible in the first ballot if the requirements in accordance with Section 30a of the Law on Political Rights of March 10, 1992 are met.

Municipalities that elect their authorities at the municipal assembly can carry out the necessary elections at the ballot box.

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau implements from the 2nd of April on the hospitals are exempted from certain regulations within the scope of fulfilling the special regulation (SonderV 20-1).
From the 2nd of April on there will be public social assistance prevention measures. Accordingly, the regulations for responsibilities for case management and assistance changed.
If a municipal or regional social service is unable to perform its duties the municipality has to provide a temporary solution. 
If they cant, the cantonal social service can temporarily transfer responsibility for case management and assistance to another regional social service or another suitable agency.
It would take over the case management and assistance in accordance with the legal requirements applicable in its municipality, if this one is not able to fulfill its duties another appropriate body takes over.
The original municipality must bear the expenses incurred by the newly responsible institution.
The cantonal social service can take appropriate coordination measures and regulate uniform criteria for assuming responsibility in an instruction.

Requests for the granting of cost credits for medical purposes that do not tolerate a delay are to be treated as appropriate and the associated payments as quickly as possible to do.

The cantonal social service can oblige the municipal and regional social services to take over the management of the case for the duration of the ongoing jurisdictional procedure
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau decided at the from the 2nd of April on the responsible official authority of the building and inspection law regulations can determine while the SonderV 20-1 is active the files to be issued can be requested in paper form as well as electronically

The responsible official authority can state that files have to be inspected digitally and that only after an agreement files can be inspected in the responsible office when well-founded instructions will be followed.

The responsible authority is empowered to extend the official deadline for public disclosures process by 30 days

In the event of a lack of urgency in time, the responsible authority can provide for the public disclosure process for a later date.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: Switzerland, Geneva--The Counsil of State made amends to voting procedures for the April 5 municipal election as of March 20. Voters will vote by post or they can deposit "their sealed voting envelope at the polls and elections service on Friday April 3 and Saturday April 4 from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. and Sunday April 5 from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m"
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: On April 9 2020, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg announced the continuation of administrative government services throughout the COVID-19 crisis, using work from home policies and online work, smaller internal meetings (when they still take place) with social distancing measures, and more flexible working hours. In addition, the Canton is providing rooms for cases where the workplace is not accessible due to health restrictions within administrative entities.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: On 8th April 2020, Swiss Canton of Neuchtel announced a restriction of access to the "creux du Van" and the "gorges de l'Areuse" - both important touristic sites in the Canton - and the closure of parkings nearby from 10th April to 19th April 2020. Only professionals and residents are allowed to access the routes concerned.

description: The Swiss Federal Council will lift the restriction on non-essential healthcare on April 27th 2020, meaning hospitals can treat non-threatening ailments and outpatient treatment offices/dentists are to be reopened. UPDATE: The restriction on non-essential healthcare will be lifted on April 26th 2020, meaning hospitals can treat non-threatening ailments and doctors offices and dentists are to be reopened.

type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: On April 17, the Swiss Canton Ticino cancels the sessions scheduled on May 4 and 5 of the Grand Council, due to the precarious situation and the few reports on the agenda. The Grand Council will meet again in plenary session on 25, 26 and probably 27 May 2020 at the "Palazzo dei Congressi" in Lugano, where a special room will be set up respecting social distances and all other security measures imposed by the situation.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description:
On March 17th the Canton Uri released an instruction to clarify how the measures by the federal government are being implemented in the Canton. They are restricting the government services by opening less counters and telling people to use online-counters.

April 17th
Prolonged until 27th of April UPDATE: Prolonged until 27th of April

type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: On April 18, the Swiss Canton Ticino announces the extension of the suspension of municipal legislation in public session until May 25, including the performance of municipal legislation in public session. In the event of absolute urgency - on objects falling within the competence of the Legislative - the Municipalities continue to be able to order the necessary measures and interventions, which they will subject a posteriori to the legislative for ratification at the end of the state of need. UPDATE: The suspension of town halls and other public municipal legislative session is extended until May 25.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: On 8th April 2020, Swiss Canton of Neuchtel announced a restriction of access to the "creux du Van" and the "gorges de l'Areuse" - both important touristic sites in the Canton - and the closure of parkings nearby from 10th April to 19th April 2020. Only professionals and residents are allowed to access the routes concerned. On 17th April 2020, the Canton extended this policy from 20th April to 10th May. UPDATE: The original restriction of access to the "Creux-du-Van" and the "gorges de l'Areuse" was set to last until 19th April 2020 but the Canton of Neuchtel extended this policy to 10th May 2020.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: Judicial authorities (Peace judgments, Magistrates' Court and Appeal Tribunal, civil chambers, including Conciliation Authorities in the field of leasing) are allowed to reassume their activities with the gradual notification of decisions and the summons to the hearings (also by videoconference, as per federal provisions), inspections, interrogations, etc., in compliance with social distances and increased hygiene standards. UPDATE: Judicial authorities are allowed to reassume their  activities on April 2020 with the gradual notification of decisions and the summons to the hearings (also by videoconference, as per federal provisions), inspections, interrogations, etc., in compliance with social distances and increased hygiene standards.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

description: On April 23, the directorate for spatial planning of the Swiss Canton of Fribourg adapted the process of allowing inspection of public dossiers for public construction plans. In order to maintain the health restrictions in the process, citizens have to register in advance via telephone or email while inspections can take a maximum of 2 hours with up to 5 attendees per appointment. This policy follows the end of federal restrictions on public construction and spatial planning on April 19.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)
